loans.name: Subira Group

texts.en:
Sikujua, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children; one is in school and the rest are grown up. For four years now, Sikujua has been running a food shop (genge-duka) where she sells products like vegetables, fruits and dry food. She starts working from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. per working day and is able to earn a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 12th loan request, which she will use to restock fruits, vegetables and dry food like sugar, beans, rice and cooking oil to resell. She used her previous loans to restock the same type of products and has paid back all her loans successfully. Sikujua used her profits to buy a plot of land. She dreams of building her own house.

Sikujua will share this loan with her loan group, "Subira," which has only two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock fruits, vegetables and dry food like sugar, beans, rice and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Mame Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de dix neuf femmes fait partie d'un Banc villageois créé le 15 décembre 2008. Les femmes habitent le même quartier et partagent beaucoup d'activités communes.Elles font du commerce, de la couture et de l’élevage.



Madame Mame Khady la représentante est âgée de 46 ans.C'est une femme mariée mère de sept enfants dont deux filles. Elle s'active dans l'aviculture et l'embouche ovine et a une bonne expérience dans ces domaines. Parallèlement elle posséde une moto Jakarta qu'elle a mis en circulation et cela renforce ses revenus mensuels.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo la main levée.


Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte acheter 2 moutons pour embouche ovine et pense les revendre pendant la période de la Tabaski.


Avec ses bénéfices, elle prend en charge les besoins de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de sa fille étudiante.
texts.en:
This group of nineteen women is part of a "Banc Villageois" loan association launched on 15 December 2008. The women live in the same neighborhood and share many common activities. They are active in commerce, sewing and raising livestock.

The group representative, Mrs. Mame Khady, is 46 years old. She is the married mother of seven children, of whom two are girls. She is active in raising poultry and fattening sheep, and has good experience in these areas.

Additionally she owns a Jakarta motorbike she rents out, which adds to her monthly income. She is standing on the right in the photo raising her hand.

With this new loan she will buy two sheep to fatten she hopes to sell during Tabaski (Muslim holy day).

With her profits she supports her family's needs and the tuition fees of her student daughter.

loans.use: buy chicks and sheep to raise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her food cooking business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase food items, including wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items, including wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Abdul from Waterloo, Western Area Rural District near Freetown. He is married with two children aged 10 years.  In 1991, Abdul established his slippers business. He began his business because after he completed sixth form, his family could not afford to pay his college fees. He raised money to start up his business, and before that he was a massuer. He works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. He says that the main challenge to the business lack of enough capital to run his business.

Abdul requires a loan in order to buy slippers, shoes and ladies jeans to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and repay his loan.  In the future, Abdul plans to renovate his business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes and ladies jeans to expand his business

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is a 54-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of Mtskheta district with his wife. His wife works at local bakery and gets 200 Gel (Georgia lari) per month. Mikheil is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a vineyard and sells wine seasonally. 

Mikheil decided to expand his agricultural business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,600 Gel for purchasing a cow. The family will start producing dairy products to sell locally. This will increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Grace is married and has four children. Her husband works as an electrician, while Grace runs a small business and farms their land. She has been farming for 3 years and farms maize and vegetables, does dairy farming, and also keeps dogs on her land. Grace was excited to start beekeeping because, as she says, “I love honey as medicine and when I use it on bread.”

This is Grace’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to pay school fees for her children and to expand her business. Her hope for the future is to “build a good house and buy land.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Oisamo

texts.ru: Оисамо 49 лет. Она в разводе и дети живут с ней. У нее два старших сына и 15-летняя дочь. Ее сыновья находятся за границей на заработках. Оисамо с дочкой и невесткой живут вместе в районе Хамадони. Оисамо с невесткой работают в дехканском хозяйстве колхозниками. В течение многих лет она работала и трудилась на чужой земле. И теперь, когда она приобрела собственную землю, Оисамо может трудиться для себя и своей выгоды. Она хочет в этом году посадить осенний урожай, для этого ей понадобится пшеничные зерна и горючая смесь для заправки трактора. Чтобы приобрести зерно и горючее она обратилась за кредитом. Оисамо нуждается в вашей поддержке для того чтобы начать свою земледельческую деятельность.
texts.en: Oisamo is 49 years old.  She is divorced and her children live with her.  She has two older sons and a 15 year old daughter.  Her sons are working abroad.  Oisamo, her daughter, and her daughter-in-law live together in Hamadoni.  Oisamo and her daughter-in-law work in the orchard of a collective farm.  For years she worked on land that was not her own.  And now, with the acquisition of her own land, Oisamo can work for herself and for her own benefit.  She wants to have an autumn harvest this year, but for this she needs grain and a fuel mixture to fill the tractor.  In order to acquire grain and fuel she asked for a loan.  Oisamo needs your support in order to begin her agricultural endeavors.

loans.use: to purchase grain and fuel in order to start her agricultural endeavors

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул замужняя женщина в возрасте 54 лет, проживает в городе Дангара. У нее двое сыновей и четверо дочерей. Все ее дети, кроме младшей дочери, которая еще учится в школе, обзаведены семьями и живут отдельно. Рузигул обеспечивает семью предоставляя услуги швеи. Она около 5 лет занимается шитьем женских национальных платьев на заказ. Она учтивая и общительная женщина, знающая свое дело. Так как у нее всегда много заказов она хочет расширить свою деятельность. С этой целью Рузиигул запрашивает кредит для покупки новой швейной машинки модели Чайка и тканей для шитья.
texts.en: Ruzigul is a married, 54 year-old woman, living in the city of Dangara.  She has two sons and four daughters.  All of the children, except for the youngest daughter who still attends school, have families and live separately.  Ruzigul provides for her family through seamstress services.  She has been involved in sewing women's national dresses to-order for about 5 years.  She is a respectful and outgoing woman who knows her business.  Because she always has many orders, she wants to expand her business.  With this goal in mind, Ruzigul is requesting this loan to buy a new Chayka sewing machine and fabrics for sewing.

loans.use: to buy a new Chayka sewing machine and fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Murodbek

texts.ru: Муродбек женат и имеет двоих сыновей, с которыми он живет в городке Истаравшан. Вот уже три года как он работает водителем КАМАЗа. Такая работа требует много сил и времени. Муродбек на своей грузовой машине предоставляет услуги перевозки и транспортировки больших габаритных товаров. Муродбек из-за работы часто опаздывает домой, но он не может не работать. Потому что его работа единственный доход в их семью. Жена Муродбека учится и следит за детьми. Она очень любит своего мужа и хочет, чтобы он сохранил свою работу. Чтобы он остался на своей работе ему нужно сохранить свой КАМАЗ.  Муродбек не до конца заплатил за свою грузовую машину и ему срочно надо найти денег, чтобы выплатить остальную часть сумму денег и сохранить работу. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. Он действительно нуждается в поддержке.
texts.en: Murodbek is married and has two sons with whom he lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He has been working as a Kamaz driver for three years.  This work requires a lot of effort and time.  Murodbek provides a service of transporting large-sized goods on his truck.  Because of his work, Murodbek comes home late, but he has to work because his work provides the sole source of income for the family.  Murodbek's wife studies and watches the children.  She loves her husband very much and wants him to keep his job.  He has to take care of his Kamaz truck in order to save his job.  Murodbek has not yet paid off his truck and has to urgently find money to repay the remainder of the amount and save his job.  He requested this loan for this purpose.  He really needs support.

loans.use: to repay the remainder of the amount for his truck and save his job

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
This is Mary Grace, 44, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, master cutter, and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Mary Grace operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.
 
Mary Grace hopes that her business will grow larger and have more customers. She dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: 23 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “23 DE FEBRERO”  iniciará el vigésimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Pamela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, venta de carne, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, tejido de chompas de alpaca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Pamela es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; este negocio lo emprendió al observar la necesidad que tenían sus vecinos de contar con un espacio de compra de comida, es por ella decide establecer el mismo. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de garrafas, utensilios) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

Algrupo acompaña la hermana de una de las socias, la que esta en el fondo de la fotografía.
texts.en:
23 de Febrero Communal Bank will start its twenty-seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office.  It's made up of nine members governed by a board of directors of which Pamela is the president.  The various businesses of the members of the communal bank include sewing jackets, meat sales, a neighborhood store, food sales, and knitting alpaca sweaters.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs such as Pamela.  She says she has been with Pro Mujer for nine cycles, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member of the institution.  Currently Pamela has a business selling food, which she decided to start because she saw that her neighbors needed to have a place to buy food.
 
The loan Pamela's going to get is to increase her capital by buying containers and utensils from the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto to use in her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate income to support her household to the extent possible, because she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the health trainings and the loans.

One of the borrower's sisters accompanies her. She is in the background of the photo.

loans.use: to buy containers and utensils

loans.name: Mahmad

texts.ru: Махмад родом из района Дангара, ему 57 лет. Он отец четверых дочерей и мастер на все руки. Махмад работает водителем на гидроэлектростанции. В свободное от работы время он чинит машины, не только свою, но машины знакомых и соседей. Несмотря на свою загруженность, он успел завестись мелкими скотами, некоторые из них попали на фотографию. Он успевает за ними следить, кормить и поить. Ему еще и помогает жена. Махмад успешно занимается овцеводством уже более 10 лет. Он хочет приобрести еще несколько голов овец, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой бизнес. Для этой покупки он просит кредит. Махмад ответственный и трудолюбивый. Желаем ему успеха!
texts.en: Mahmad is from the Dangara district. He is 57 years old. He a father to four daughters and a jack of all trades. Mahmad works as a driver at a hydroelectric power station. In his free time when he is not working, he repairs cars - not just his own, but also those of his friends and neighbors. In spite of his workload, he's had time to start raising small livestock, some of which are in the photograph. He's managed to look after them, feed them and water them. His wife helps him with this. Mahmad has successfully been rearing sheep for more than 10 years. He wants to purchase even more sheep to increase his herd and expand his business. He is requesting a loan for this purchase. Mahmad is responsible and hardworking. We wish him success!

loans.use: To buy sheep to increase his herd.

loans.name: Maralkhan

texts.ru: Маралхан 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывает 6 детей. В 2000 году, начала бизнес в торговле детскими вещами, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Маралхан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Маралхан смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Маралхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Маралхан планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на обучение своих детей.
texts.en:
Maralkhan is 40 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising six children. In 2000, she started her business of selling children's items with initial start-up capital in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Having been able to develop her business and find loyal customers, Maralkhan has an average monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to the hard work she put into her business, Maralkhan has been able to increase her turnover and develop her business. 
For the purpose of the further expansion her business, Maralkhan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase her sales turnover. Maralkhan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in further sales turnover. She also intends to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes for retail sale.

loans.name: Marselina

texts.en:
Marselina, a 42 year-old woman, is married to Gustaf, a 47 year-old man. They are blessed with three children: Sony, 17, in the third grade of Senior High School; Tasya, 13, first grade of Junior High School; and Zefanya, age 4.
Marselina has been running the kiosk business since two years ago in order to support her husband to fulfill their family needs. She started the kiosk business using her own capital. She desired to add a display window and also more stock to her kiosk, but she lacks the money to do so. Therefore, she is requesting an individual loan of 4,500,000 IDR from Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation (TLM). The loan will be used to purchase the display window and more stocks for her kiosk such as detergents, soap, soft drinks, snacks, instant noodles, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a display window and more stock for her kiosk such as detergents, soap, soft drinks, snacks, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 28 years old and an energetic young woman from the Samtredia district of West Georgia. She is married and has two infant children. Teona and her husband are unemployed at the moment. The family has recently moved to new house and started living separately, but they are still dependent on parents financially. That is the main reason why Teona decided to start a small scale trading business to generate her own income and feed her children herself. 
With the received startup credit, Teona will set up a store where cookies and snacks will be sold. There will be a stationery department in her store as well and Teona hopes the business will be successful as the store is located in front of the school and school children will be her regular customers.
Teona believes in her enthusiasm and anticipates her initiative will make profit for family needs.

loans.use: to set up a small store where cookies and stationery will be sold

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru: Зеби 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Зеби- средне-специальное образование, работает медицинским работником в местной больнице. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зеби занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зеби, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 21 овца. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зеби обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зеби планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей
texts.en: Zebi is 46 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Zebi has a secondary specialized education. She works as a medical technician at a local hospital. As the main source of income for her family, Zebi practices livestock breeding. She started this business 15 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zebi's hard work, she currently has on 3 milk cows and 21 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 7,500 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Zebi turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Zebi plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. He has five children and has been doing this work for 15 years. His primary income is derived from selling milk, eggs, crops, transportation services and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is "earning from agriculture." His biggest challenge is "access to funds." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Tuiyo."

Henry was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied that he knew about juhudi kilimo through a group member. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. His reply was, "I learned how to work in a group to boost one's income."

Henry's highest monthly expense is business-related. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Henry said that it will boost his dairy-farming.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Henry owns a cow, poultry and motorcycle. But he does not own a pig, pump, bicycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD player.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
This is Temur, who is 33 years old and lives in the town of Rustavi, near the capital city of Georgia. He is married with three young children. Temur represents a telecommunications company in Rustavi and owns a small office on the crowded street of the town where mobile phones are sold. 

Temur also offers cell-phone repair service to locals and his monthly income is nearly $360. Temur’s spouse helps him run the business. The young couple work hard to ensure that their children have better living conditions and a good education for progressing in life. 

As his earnings are not enough to cover utilities and food costs, Temur has decided to diversify the business and start up a small café, where doner will be sold. Doner (kebab/sandwich/gyro) has become a very popular fast-food dish in the last several years. According to Temur’s estimation, sales will be high as the location where he plans to hire the commercial space is crowded with people.

The income from the café will be a great support for the family, as the children need much and Temur is not able to give them what they need with his current modest earnings.

Temur appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to start up a food cafe.

loans.name: Angello

texts.en: Angello decided to supplement his construction business with repairing bicycles because this type of business does not require a big investment of capital. He had learned this skill from his uncle. Angello operates the two businesses in the same place for easy monitoring. He will be able to stock his business with building materials such as nails and cement and will also buy spanners and bicycle tubes to have his business moving well. Angello will be able to raise more income with the two businesses. Angello is a hardworking businessman.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials and bicycle parts for his business.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a married woman with five children, one in school while the rest are underage. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Cheikh Ahmed Tidiane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh Ahmed, âgé de 49 ans, est un enseignant de profession qui a une expérience de plus de 15 ans. Il est marié et père de six enfants. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et mettre toute sa famille dans les meilleures conditions de vie, il allie son travail avec  le commerce qu’il a démarré il y a juste 4 ans avec un fond propre. Il vend selon la période tout produit susceptible de générer un profit. Avec la rentrée des classes qui coïncide cette période de l’année, il décide de faire un prêt (son second) afin d’acheter des fournitures scolaires et de les revendre dans son école, là où il sert. Cheikh Ahmed possède une clientèle assez régulière parmi aussi les gens du quartier qui le connaisse à travers cette activité.
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer et grâce au crédit, il peut améliorer cette dernière. 
Comme ambition, il rêve d’avoir un grand poulailler et de développer son commerce à travers les financements reçus de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Mr Cheikh Ahmed is 49 years old and is a teacher with more than 15 years experience in the profession.  He is married with six children.  In order to meet the financial needs of his family, and ensure the best standard of living for them, he operates as a trader, alongside his job.  He started to do this 4 years ago using his own funds to begin with.  He sells anything that will make a profit at that time.  

At this time of year, the children return to school so he is requesting this second loan to buy school supplies to resell in the school where he works.  Cheikh Ahmed has a regular customer base amongst the local people who know him well, thanks to his business.  

He is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his household, and, thanks to this loan, he will be able to increase the amount he can afford to spend.  His ambition is to own a large chicken coop and develop his business thanks to loans from UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Meet Joseph. He is 31 years old and comes from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married with two children ages 5 years and 9 years.  Over the past 10 years, Joseph has established his local food business. He began his business because his parents did not have money to sponsor his education so he decided to go into business.  He works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business are storage facilities and high cost of transportation.

Joseph requires a loan in order to purchase more beans, 'gari' (cassava couscous) and bags of groundnuts for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to empower himself and increase his business. In the future, Joseph plans to build a big house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, 'gari' and bags of groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is 45 years old. She lives in Batumi city with her husband and two grown sons.  The elder son works as a waiter at a restaurant and gets a small monthly salary. Tamara sells groceries of first necessity in a store located in a crowded street of Batumi. Her clients are locals and passerby as well. The business is going well but the store is newly started and it needs financial support for further development. Her plan now is to continue to work on her business and to make it grow. 

Tamara applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of a Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $300 will help Tamara to improve her store and enlarge the quantity of products. She will buy supplies of dairy products and beverages. With this loan Tamara will expand her grocery store and attract more customers. She promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to add dairy products and beverages to her grocery store

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rainforest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Francis is married, and has one child. His wife works as a teacher, while he farms their land. He has been farming for four years, and is currently growing maize and tending to a tree plantation on his land. Francis likes beekeeping because it does not involve hard labour and still produces good returns. 

This is Francis’ first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to buy even more beehives. In the future, Francis hopes “to buy a home and live a good life with my family.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Kinanasi

texts.en:
Kinanasi is a business woman who is very hardworking. She is married with four school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kinanasi has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en:
Ikhlas is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. so her husband appears in the photo. 

Ikhlas is a 20-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband in a very simple and old house. Ikhlas works as a teacher in a public school. She gets a very low wage. Her husband is also working in a small grocery store he owns; it has been open for two years. He always wants to improve his business.

Ikhlas took a USD Murabha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to improve his grocery store and buy all the needed stock that customers often demand.  This will improve his business and also his income

loans.use: to improve their grocery store and buy all the stock that customers often demand.

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Alusine from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married with two children, 3 years and 6 years old. He began this business because he wants to create a permanent source of income to support himself and his family,  

Alusine runs a general store; he sells drinks, cigarettes, ketchup and toothpaste, etc. He has been running this business for eight years. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

Alusine has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, ketchup and toothpaste. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installments and have his daily meals. In the future, he plans to open another shop. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, ketchup and toothpaste.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rainforest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Anne is married, and has three children. Her husband works as a nurse, while Anne engages in projects on their land: she is currently growing bananas, vegetables and sugarcane. Anne is excited to become a beekeeper because “I enjoy honey on bread and in tea and the income is encouraging.”

This is Anne’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income to pay university and college fees for her children. In the future, Anne hopes to “finish building my house, which I have already started.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан родился в 1992 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он целеустремленный и позитивный молодой человек. Хасан в средней школе учился отлично и всегда мечтал поступить в университет. В этом году его мечта сбылась, и он поступил в Таджикский Технологический Университет. Хасан учится в факультете Экономика и производства. Хасан является активным студентом 1 курса. Он имеет хорошую репутацию среди своих однокурсников. Хасан запрашивает займ на сумму 950 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Hasan was born in 1992. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. He is a self-motivated and positive young man. Hasan did very well in secondary school and always dreamed of going to university. This year, his dream came true and he was accepted into Tajikistan Technical University. Hasan studies business and economics. Hasan is an active first-year student. He has a good reputation amongst his classmates. Hasan is requesting a loan in the amount of 950 USD to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. so her husband appears in the photo. 

Samah is a 30-year-old married woman from Tulkarem city. She lives with her husband and  three sons and two daughters in a very simple and old house. 

Her husband works in a small grocery store he owns; it has been in operation for two years. He always wants to improve his business

Samah took out a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to improve her husband's grocery store and buy all the stock that customers often demand. This will improve his business and his income

loans.use: to improve her husband's grocery store and buy all the stock that customers often demand.

loans.name: Ziyadabubu

texts.ru: Зиядабубу 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 5 детей. У Зиядабубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зиядабубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 500 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зиядабубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зиядабубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зиядабубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Ziyadabubu is 57 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Ziyadabubu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Ziyadabubu practices livestock breeding. She started this business 30 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 500 som (KGS). Thanks to Ziyadabubu's hard work, she currently has on 2 milk cows and 10 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Ziyadabubu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Ziyadabubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 33-year-old married woman from a small village near Ramallah city. She lives with her husband and three sons and one daughter in a very simple old house. Her husband works as a construction worker with a very low wage. For the past five months, Fatmeh has operated a small grocery store to help her husband with the family expenses. She always wants to improve this business

Fatmeh took out a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to improve her grocery store and buy all the items that customers often demand. This will improve her business and the family income

The photo was taken while Fatmeh was working in her grocery store.

loans.use: to improve her grocery store and buy all the items that customers often demand

loans.name: Mavsuma

texts.ru: Мавсума родилась в 1971 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Она живет далеко от города в сельской местности и для нее весьма благополучно развевать бизнес скотоводством. Мавсума более 18 лет занимается скотоводством. Она имеет большой опыт по данному бизнесу и знает все тонкости своего дела. Мавсуме по введению бизнеса помогают муж и сын. Мавсума планирует увеличить количество скота и таким образом получать больше дохода. Мавсума запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavsuma was born in 1971. She is married and has five children. She lives far from the city in the countryside, so it is easy for her to develop her animal husbandry business. Mavsuma has practiced animal husbandry for more than 18 years. She has a lot of experience with this business and knows all of its intricacies. Mavsuma's husband and son help her with this business. Mavsuma plants to increase the size of her herd and in doing so, receive greater earnings. Mavsuma is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 USD to buy cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim, 40, from Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 1 and 15. He began this business because he wants to create a permanent source of income to take care of his family.

Ibrahim runs a general stock business; he sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soap. He has been running this business since the end of the rebel war. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. He says that the main challenge to his business is the high rate of theft within the community.

Ibrahim has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water and mayonnaise. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children's school fees and buy a plot of land. In the future, He plans to build his own permanent business. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 4 years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and a good client list. She is a mother of 3 children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy a stock of grains, biscuits and sugar from the market at lower rates. She would then be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She hopes to increase  her income and wishes to utilize part of revenues for personal expenses and to increase business capital. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of grains, biscuits and sugar.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 26 years old and is a single woman living with her parents and three siblings in Koh Kong province. After graduation from high school Srey moved temporarily to Phnom Penh to pursue a bachelor's degree in accounting. During her first year she also works as a civil servant for a ministry of state.

Due to the family’s economic situation, she has requested a loan in the amount of $500 USD from lenders through HKL. With this loan she will pay her university fee of $400 USD per year and use the remaining balance for materials she needs to support her course. She is very happy and thankful to all lenders for this loan to seriously motivate her in her education. She expects to have a well-paid job after graduating with this degree.

loans.use: to pay her university fee of $400 USD per year and to purchase materials she needs to support her course.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 29 years old and has been stitching clothes for the past 7 years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to create a healthier source of income.
.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in western Kenya, and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Jason is married, and has three children. His wife works as a nurse, and Jason has a job in town. In his spare time, he raises rabbits, which are a new and lucrative commodity in the area. Jason is excited to become a beekeeper because honey is medicinal, and he will have a supply of it for himself and his family. 

This is Jason’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to improve his farming and help support his last-born son. When asked about his hopes for the future, Jason said, “I want to do well in life and educate my kid to the highest level.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Sillah

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Sillah from Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. He is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 12. 

Sillah runs a general stock business; he sells assorted drinks. He began this business because he wants to create a permanent source of income to take care of his family; he has been running this business since 2002. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  He says that the main challenge to his business is the high rate of theft within the community.

Sillah has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and mayonnaise. 

The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children's school fees, and buy a plot of land. 

In the future, he plans to change his business to selling fuel. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is 23 years old and is from Qalqilia city. She is married and the mother of two sons. Reem's husband is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Reem is a student at the university in her last year. She studies social service. She would like to complete her study and work in the schools. This will help her husband with part of the family's expenses. 


Reem took a loan of USD from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan Reem will be able to finish her studies.
 
Reem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a business selling milk for the past six years. She has one cow & one buffalo to milk. 

She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

This is her second year with Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase one more cow. 

She expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Mashurwe Group

texts.fr:
Julienne  fait partie du groupe Mashurwe  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a  38 ans et est mariée  à Pascal, un fonctionnaire. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés  de 3 mois  à 18 ans, dont  4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce d' oignons, d' ailles,...  depuis 1 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’oignons, d’ailles, …  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait faire le commerce d’importation des produits de Dubaï  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Julienne, age 38, is a member of the group Mashurwe and she lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Pascal, a civil servant, and they have five children aged 3 months to 18 years old, four of whom go to school. 

Julienne has been selling onions and garlic for the past year. This is her 8th loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use the funds to bolster her working capital and stock up on onions and garlic to sell and increase her revenue. 

In the coming years, Julienne would like to start importing merchandise from Dubaï. She wants her children to pursue their studies.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital and stock up on onions and garlic to sell and increase her revenue.

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi is 43 years old and is married.  He lives in a small village near Ramallah city. He lives with his wife and three children (two sons and one daughter) in a very simple and old house. Majdi opened a small grocery store in the city which he has been running for four months. It is a very good business and located in a crowded area. He would like to improve his business but he does not have enough money.


Majdi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve his grocery store and buy all the needed stock that customers often request.  This will improve his business and also the family's income.

Majdi appears in the photo while he was working in his grocery store.

loans.use: to improve his grocery store and buy all the needed stock that customers often request

loans.name: Abdel Hadi

texts.en:
Abdel Hadi is a 32-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father for three daughters. Abdel is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Abdel also is a student in the university. He studies press. He would like to complete his study and work in this field.

Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him  to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able complete his study.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Hesbon

texts.en:
Hesbon lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and the concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Hesbon is married and has three children. Both he and his wife run businesses, as well as farming their land. They have been farming for 17 years and are currently growing sugarcane, vegetables, maize and rearing a cow. 

This is Hesbon’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to expand his business. Hesbon’s hope for the future is to save up enough money to construct rental houses.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Naheel

texts.en:
Naheel is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo. 

Naheel is a 21-year-old single young lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a humble house in the city. Naheel's brother is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Naheel is a student in the university. She studies educational science basic stage. She would like to complete her study and work in a school. Naheel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Naheel will be able to work on her homework and reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Osman from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. He is married and has two children, age 1 and 8 years. 

For the past 10 years, Osman has been establishing his phone accessories business. He began this business because he wanted to create his own permanent source of income.  Before that, he was a massager. 

He works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Osman requires a loan in order to buy phone chargers, extensions and variety of phone accessories for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and pay his child's school fees. In the future, Osman plans to import his goods from a neighboring country. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy phone chargers, extensions and a variety of phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Tevos

texts.en:
Tevos is a young farmer from Khndzoresk village in the Syuniq region. He lives with his wife. The family covers their basic needs through breeding of cows and hens. This is the only source of income for them. Tevos sells the agricultural products in the local market.  

As the life gets more expensive day by day, Tevos wants to enlarge the livestock a little bit to be able to meet the needs of his family more effectively. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a big support and will enable him to purchase three cows and some forage for the cattle. Tevos and his wife highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for helping them maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three cows and some forage for the cattle.

loans.name: Horeyeh

texts.en:
Horeyeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo. 

Horeyeh is a 19-year-old single young lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a humble house in the city. Horeyeh's brother is a construction worker where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Horeyeh is a student in the university. She studies public relations. She would like to complete her study and work in a local company.

Horeyeh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Horeyeh will be able to work on her homework and reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is an 18-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a humble house in the city. Rami's father is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Rami is a student in the university. He studies humanitarian science. He would like to complete his studies and find a job to help his family.

Rami took a $1,250 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Rami will be able to work on his homework and reports.
 
Rami appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for the growth of her tailoring business, which she has been running for the past 13 years. She is 52 years old, and is a well-educated married woman with two sons and two daughters living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She wants to expand her tailoring business by one more shop so that she can provide more options to her clients to stitch more kinds of clothes like T-shirts, uniforms, etc. This will allow her to increase her monthly savings as well. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one and will greatly help in the growth of her business.

loans.use: to pay for a new shop.

loans.name: A`zamkhon

texts.ru: Аъзамхон из района Хамадони, ему 40 лет, он отец двух сыновей и одной дочери. Аъзамхон имеет высшее педагогическое образование и в течение 10 лет работает в школе учителем. Его жена не работает и ведет домашнее хозяйство. Дома у Аъзамхона как и у всех его односельчан имеется скот для нужды семьи. Сейчас Аъзамхон просит кредит, чтобы закупить пару бычков и заняться бизнесом по откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Для начала такого бизнеса сумма, которую он берет маленькая, так как некоторые породы коров и быков стоят дорого. Аъзамхон решил не рисковать с большой суммой. Сперва он хочет получить необходимый опыт в бизнесе и затем он уже планирует расширить бизнес. Он надеется, что такая деятельность принесет ему и его семье хороший доход и их условия проживания улучшатся.
texts.en: A'zamkhon is 40 years old and from the Hamadoni region. He is a father to two sons and one daughter. A'zamkhon has a degree in pedagogy and has been working for 10 years in a school as a teacher. His wife doesn't work and takes care of the home. As do all his neighbours, A'zamkhon keeps cattle for his family's personal needs. Now he is requesting a loan to buy a pair of steers and run a business fattening and selling big-horned cattle. The amount he is borrowing to start his business is small, since some breeds of cows and steers cost a lot. A'zamkhon has decided not to take a chance with such a large sum. First he wants to acquire the necessary experience in the business and then he plans to expand it. He hopes that this work will bring him and his family good revenue and that their living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy a pair of steers, to start a business fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr:
Madame Sadio, une dame de 38 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant, est enseignante de profession où elle a fait plus de cinq ans de service. Elle sert actuellement dans un village.  Parallèlement, Sadio fait du commerce depuis maintenant 3 ans. Elle a démarré avec un capital de 50000F CFA. Son activité consiste à acheter des fournitures scolaires à l’ouverture des classes et de les revendre dans l’école. Cela est une opportunité pour les parents qui ne seront pas obligé de venir en ville pour se ravitailler. Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle peut s’occuper des dépenses liées à ses parents et gérer aussi sa domestique car en ce qui concerne les dépenses de la famille, c’est son époux qui le prend en charge. Cela lui permet aussi d’épargner et de prévoir certaines dépenses personnelles.
Comme projet, elle désire construire un jour, sa propre maison avec l’appui financier de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sadio, age 38, is the married mother of one child. She is a teacher and has been working in this field for over five years. She is currently teaching in a village. As a sideline, Sadio started a commercial activity three years ago with a capital of 50,000F CFA. She buys school supplies at the start of the school year and sells them on site, in the schools. This is helpful to parents who no longer have to travel to town to buy these supplies. 

Her profits are used to assist with her parents’ expenses and to pay her maid. Her own household expenditures are handled by her husband. This allows her to save money and to cover some personal expenses.

Her long term goal is to build a house with the financial support of IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She has some savings and requested a loan of 35,000 Rs (Pakistani rupees) to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation, and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a humble house in the city. Mohammad's father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Mohammad is a student at the university. He studies educational science basic stage. He would like to complete his study and work in this field.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to complete his study.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a humble house in the city. Mohammad's father is a construction worker with a seasonal income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad is a student in the university. He studies human sciences. He would like to complete his studies and find a job to help his family.

Mohammad took an $850 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to work on his homework and reports.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 21-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a humble house in the city. Ibrahim's father is an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Ibrahim is a student in the university. He studies mathematics. He would like to complete his studies and find a job in a local school to help his family.

Ibrahim took a $700 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to work on his homework and reports.
 
Ibrahim appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mohsafar

texts.ru:
Мохсафару 31 год. Она не замужем и у нее нет детей. Мохсафар живет в районе Бохтар с родителями. Они ей помогают во всем, в том числе и в бизнесе. Три года назад Мохсафар начала свою деятельность по купле и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Мохсафару нравится проводить время на скотном дворе. Корову, которую вы видите на фотографии это ее любимая. Она очень большая и дает много молока. Махсафару нравится доить корову. 
  Когда Мохсафар получит кредит она собирается закупить телят из рынка района Бохтар или района Дж.Руми. Она около трех лет в этой сфере деятельности, но все равно ей помогают родители, за что она им благодарна.
texts.en:
Mohsafar is 31. She is unmarried and has no children, and lives in the Bohtar region with her parents. They help her with everything, including her business. Three years ago Mohsafar started her occupation buying and selling big-horned cattle. She likes spending time in the cattle yard. The cow you see in the photo is her favourite. She is very large and gives a lot of milk, and Mohsafar likes milking her.

When Mohsafar receives the loan she will buy calves from the market in either the Bohtar or J. Rumi region. She has about three years of experience in this line of business, but all the same her parents help her, for which she is grateful.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Dibida, commune de kalake, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de céréales, des tissus et de la restauration.                                                                                                                       
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Fatoumata la personne assise au milieu, est vendeuse de farine de blé frite. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de farine et un demi-sac de sucre. La vente se fait deux fois par semaine Mercredi et Dimanche. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10000 FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group consists exclusively of married women who average 43 years of age and four children each. They live in extended traditional families in the village of Dibida located in the commune of Kalake, prefecture de Baroueli, which is in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through ties of kinship. Their activities include the sale of cereals, fabrics, and restaurant services. 

This is their 4th group loan. Fatoumata sells fried wheat flour. She is the group member sitting in the center. She plans to buy one sack of flour and one half sack of sugar. She conducts her sales twice a week, on Wednesdays and Sundays. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which she will use to sustain her activity and to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to make fried wheat flour.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Sharifan is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has seven years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts through the years. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Recently, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. 

She has been doing a business of tailoring for four years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that, if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the daily household expenses with the educational needs of the children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household expenses while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now she is requesting a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces, etc. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand of her customers. Zubaida hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces, etc.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Meet Osman. He is a 35-year-old from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. He is married with three children aged 6 years through 14 years. For the past 10 years, Osman has established his local food business. He began his business because his parents did not send him to school, so he was trained in business. He works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business are storage facilities and the high cost of transportation.

Osman requires a loan in order to purchase more beans, gari (fermented cassava flakes) and bags of ground nuts for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to empower himself and increase his business. In the future, Osman plans to build a big house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, gari and bags of ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is married and has seven children, three of whom go to school; the rest are adults. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's basic needs.

Mwanaidi has operated a coconut-selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, Mwanaidi wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts to resell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 37-year-old energetic, married woman. She works from home as a tailor and has been in this line of work for the past four years. She feels proud to contribute to her household income. When Alia was not earning, her family was going through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Due to limited resources, none of their four children was sent to school. She felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. 

She is a brave woman and her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s why Alia has requested 20,000 Rs (Pakistani rupees); her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine, spools of threads and buttons. She wishes to expand her business and provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, spools of threads and buttons.

loans.name: Tita Group

texts.en:
Nora is the featured borrower of Tita’s group, whose members have been friends since leaving the Philippines to fight for their living working as housekeepers in Lebanon.


A 44-year-old married mother of two children, Nora, on the right in the photo, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for her children's education fees. The other group members are Lorena, in the center of the picture, and Jeneffer, on the left.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education fees

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 42-year-old married woman doing business selling milk for the past eight years. She has two cows and five buffalo in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. 

This is her second year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is 18 years old and single. He is from Jabalia where he lives with his family. His mother is an employee in the Ministry of Health in Jabalia where she gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Fares is a student in the university, studying health sciences. He would like to complete his studies and find a job in a clinic center to help his family.

Fares is requesting a loan from FATEN, which he will use to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, he will be able to do his homework and reports.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a widowed woman with six children: three adults and three school-going. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaidi has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past ten years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Mwanaidi is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is a 31-year-old lady, and she has been doing a business of animal sales and purchasing for a period of about one year. She has one cow and two goats. She purchases small animals and sells them in the animal market when they have matured. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. She has four children; she is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. Now she has requested a loan of 20,000 Rs (Pakistani rupees) to purchase one more goat. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase one more goat.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Rosa viene trabajando muy bien en forma conjunta en la comunidad organizando actividades para fortalecer el comité.  Son de una zona bastante alejada y eminentemente rural, donde todas las integrantes hacen actividades agrícolas.
Todas ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, y de esa forma todas quieren dar a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida digna. Ramona, es una persona muy trabajadora, quien arduamente se esfuerza para ayudar a su familia. Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales, y así seguir con la cría y venta y tener los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa group is working very well together in the community and organize activities to strengthen the group. They live in a remote rural area and all are engaged in farming.

The women raise and sell farmyard animals and through their work provide their families with what they need for a decent life.

Ramona is a very hardworking person who makes a great effort to help her family. She is seeking a loan to buy special feed for her animals so she can continue raising and selling them. The income this provides is used to support her family.

loans.use: buy special animal feed

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
San Jorge es un grupo nuevo que tiene muchas ansias de poder crecer y mejorar sus vidas, está en su primer ciclo, y además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una.
Rosa es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella vende joyas variadas a sus clientes y clientas, sobre pedidos. Cuenta que se hizo ya conocida ya entre sus clientes y es por eso que le va muy bien. Ella es muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante por medio de su propio esfuerzo y sacrificio. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder comprar joyas y revenderlas y de esa forma poder seguir luchando e ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
San Jorge is a new group and its members have a great desire to better their lives.  The group is in its first cycle and the members are participating in the survey for eliminating poverty, in order to learn about one another’s situation.

Rosa is one of the group’s members and sells various types of jewelry to order to her customers.   She says that she has become known to her customers, so things are going well for her.  She is hardworking and dedicated and wants to get ahead through her own efforts and sacrifice.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy jewelry for resale and in this way be able to continue working and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Las Mercedes está en el ciclo 17 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una de ellas ha mejorado bastante su situación de pobreza gracias a su esfuerzo.
La Sra. Tomasa, una de las integrantes tiene una despensa en su casa, en la que día a día trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella es una persona muy luchadora, que con gran esfuerzo está creciendo y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Comenta que al principio cuando empezó le fue muy complicado, pero hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, verduras, panificados, y demás para volver a surtir su despensa. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Mercedes Group is in its 17th loan cycle in the Women's Committee Program, in which all members work and help each other get ahead. The group members have undertaken the Poverty Spotlight, which allows each member to lift themselves from poverty through their own efforts. 

One of the group members, Sra. Tomasa, has a store in her home, where she works long hours starting early in the morning. Sra. Tomasa is a very tenacious person who is striving to improve her life  through her tremendous efforts. She observes that running a business was very complicated at the beginning, but that she now has excellent customers. 

Sra. Tomasa is applying for a loan to purchase wholesale foods, vegetables, baked goods, and other products to boost her store's inventory. She is grateful for the opportunity the loan will provide her to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: wholesale foods, vegetables, baked goods, and other products

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer de 62 años de edad, pero con una alegría y una vivacidad de una joven de 20 años, vive al lado de su esposo  con el cual tiene 3 hijos los cuales son mayores y por quienes ha luchado con mucha fuerza y dedicación para convertirlos en personas de bien. Con mucho esfuerzo, ahorro y el apoyo de su esposo, logro iniciar su negocio de servicio de vulcanizado de motos y mototaxi, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; ella cree que su negocio está saliendo adelante porque ofrece un buen servicio y sobre todo trata a los clientes con mucha amabilidad.

Judtih está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una compresora de segunda mano para su negocio, de esta manera ella podrá tener las herramientas necesarias para realizar su trabajo y así mejorar sus ingresos y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una gran taller y poder seguir apoyando a mi familia”.
texts.en:
Judith is a 62-year-old woman who has the cheerfulness and vigor of a 20-year-old.  She lives alongside her husband and they have three grown children.  For this reason, she has strived very hard and with dedication to help them become good people.  

With great effort, the use of her savings, and the help of her husband, Judith was able to start a business that provides tire repair services for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis.  She works at her business approximately 10 hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers in a day.  Judith believes her business is moving forward because she offers good service and treats her customer with great friendliness.  

She is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the assistance they have provided, Judith will be able to buy a secondhand compressor for her business.  This will enable her to have the necessary equipment for doing the work.  As a result, she will be able to improve her income.  Judith continues toward fulfilling her greatest wish of having a large workshop and being able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand compressor.

loans.name: Alcides Rafael

texts.es: Alcides de 56 años de edad, habita en el municipio de soledad con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 28 y 30 años respectivamente. Alcides desde hace 3 años vende medicamentos, negocio que inició con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos familiares, pues es un contador publico juramentado, que también se dedica a su profesión. Su  cónyuge es su mayor apoyo en su negocio y en su vida, y ellos venden directamente al consumidor final, durante 13 horas diarias de domingo a domingo. Sus principales proveedores son los laboratorios y mayoristas, por ello logra obtener productos de muy buena calidad y ofrecerlos a un buen precio. Sus principales compradores son sus vecinos y personas ocasionales que en la comunidad circundan. En la actualidad está aplicando a  un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará medicamentos varios, al por mayor y de contado, con ello contribuye a hacerle mas saludable la vida, a todos los moradores de su barrio y de los alrededores de él. Su meta es fortalecer su capital de trabajo, porque su mayor desafío es no tener el suficiente dinero,  para mantener un stock de los productos, que mas rotan en su tienda de medicamentos y tener mas inventarios esto si que es bueno para su clientela y para sus ingresos..
texts.en:
Alcides, 50, lives in the town of Soledad with his wife and two children who are 28 and 30.  For three years he's been selling medicines, a business he started up to increase his family's income.
