He's also a certified public accountant.  His wife is his biggest supporter in business and in life.  They sell directly to the end consumer 13 hours a day, seven days a week.  His main suppliers are laboratories and wholesalers, so he's able to get high-quality products and offer them at a good price.  His main buyers are his neighbors and walk-ins from all around the community.  

The Kiva loan Alcides is seeking is this time is his first one with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He'll buy a variety of medicines wholesale and for cash.  With them he'll contribute to making life healthier for all the inhabitants of his own and the surrounding neighborhoods.  His biggest challenge is insufficient funds, so his goal is to shore up his working capital in order to maintain the stock of the highest-turnover products and have more inventory.  That's good for his clientele and his income.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines wholesale and for cash.

loans.name: Gustavo Eugenio

texts.es: Gustavo, a sus 44 años de edad es casado y padre de 5 hijos. Es agricultor y posee una finca donde tiene varias hectáreas de cultivos con productos como el ñame, yuca y plátano, cuyas cosechas son comercializadas en el mercado de la región y así obtiene el dinero necesario para sacar adelante su gran familia. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, activo y pujante, esto le ha dado fuerzas para salir siempre adelante, sobrepasando los diversos obstáculos que se le presentan. Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, venenos, entre otros) con lo que podrá continuar cuidando sus cultivos y de esta forma lograr que las cosechas sean más productivas y pueda aumentar las ventas de los alimentos, lo que afectará positivamente sus finanzas. Gustavo sueña con poder continuar con sus cultivos, haciéndolos crecer día a día, para que cada cosecha que recolecte sea mucho más productiva que la anterior y así tener una buena rentabilidad que le ayude a mantener una buena calidad de vida, brindar una excelente educación a sus hijos y satisfacer todas las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en: Gustavo, 44, is married and has five children. He is a farmer and has a farm with several hectares of crops like yam, yucca, and plantains. The harvest is sold in the market in the region, and this way he has the money he needs to move his large family forward. He is a hardworking, active, and strong man. This has given him the strength to always advance, overcoming the various obstacles that have come up. He is asking for the loan to buy agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizer, pesticides, among other things) with which he will be able to keep caring for his crops and make the harvests more productive. This way, he can increase his sales of the cropa, which will positively affect his finances. Gustavo dreams of being able to continue with his crops, making them grow day by day, so that every harvest produces more than the previous one. This way, he will have a good income, which will help him maintain a good quality of life, provide an excellent education for his children, and meet all his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure, fertilizer, pesticides, among other things)

loans.name: Marraim

texts.en:
Marraim is a 38-year-old married woman. She is doing the business of animal sale and purchase along with her husband for the past 20 years. 

She has two buffaloes, one cow, and six goats. She also sells their milk as a secondary source of her income. She takes care of the livestock, while her husband sells them to the neighbors and in the local market. 

Marraim has six children but she could send only four of them to the school due to the financial conditions. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing, and education.

In order to make huge profits, Marraim has requested for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy one more goat. She dreams to provide all her children with good and quality education and a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy one more goat.

loans.name: Maryum

texts.en:
Maryum is a 32-year-old, married woman, and a mother of 2 children. She has been running a business of clothing sales for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city, and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Maryum has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a widowed woman with seven children: four of whom attend school, one underage, and two adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has been selling cows at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan of  20,000 KES to purchase cattle feeds for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feeds for her business.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 27-year-old, married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching clothes. She has got a lot of appreciation from her community. 

She accepted the fact that, if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet their household expenses. Rehana and her husband jointly manage their daily household chores while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Rehana has now requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more reels of thread and packs of buttons and laces in different colors. She is in her fourth loan cycle and she shows good credit behavior. 

With this loan, Rehana will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a good standard of living to her family members, through all her hard work in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread and packs of buttons and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira, age 63, is from the village of Sakobo, Kakheti region. She is widowed and lives alone. Naira earns a living through working in the local farmers fields as a hired worker, and her income is modest and unstable. In order to generate more income, Naira decided to produce Churchkhela (Traditional Georgian sausage-shaped candies, produced with grape must, flour, and threaded nuts onto a string) to sell. But she doesn't have grape, the main ingredient for it.
 
With the received credit, Naira will purchase grapes, squeeze them, and produce grape juice. She will make Churchkhela and sell the candies for a good price. Churchkhela is one of the main dishes for the New Year’s table, and it’s possible to keep it for several months. 

Naira’s products will have high quality, and after selling them, Naira will get good profit.

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to produce Churchkhela (Georgian candy) to sell.

loans.name: Lekhram

texts.en: Lekhram is 53 years old and has a family with four school-aged children. To pay the tuition of his children, he works as a watchman at night and during the day as a rice farmer. His wife works as a domestic worker. Lekhram received his first loan from Seva MFI in 2009. Since then, he received nine small loans and repaid those on time. The goal of Mr. and Mrs. Lekhram is to give their children a good education and future. For this, they need to expand their rice production so that they can have more income and savings. Lekhram needs a new loan of SRD 7,000 to invest in their rice production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice production

loans.name: Mahinder

texts.en: Mahinder is 57 years old and has a family that includes four children. He inherited 12 hectares for rice cultivation from his parents on which he plants together with his sons. For additional income, he recently purchased a pickup truck and works with that at a lumberyard. Mahinder is a good borrower. He received eight loans from Seva MFI and repaid those fully. With his profits, he bought a second pickup truck for one of his sons. Mahinder's and his family’s goal is to save for the wedding of their children. Therefore, he needs a new loan of SRD 12,000 to expand his rice production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Erick

texts.es:
Erick,es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz, actualmente estudia en la universidad en la carrera de Publicidad y Marketing.
Erick percibe ingresos diarios de la renta de su vehículo que trabaja como transporte publico y también un ingreso mensual del servicio de administración y limpieza de un parqueo y con los ingresos que obtiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para capital de inversión como su aporte ya que desea invertir con otros socios en actividades de organización de eventos (como veladas artísticas, shows, recepciones sociales, etc.)para lo cual se necesita un capital inicial.
El sueño de Erick es concluir su carrera y tener su propia empresa de eventos y con eso mejorara sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Erick is not married and doesn’t have any children. He has a single room in his parents’ house which is located in the city of La Paz. He is currently studying publicity and marketing at university.

Erick earns money by hiring out his vehicle for public transport, and he also gets a monthly income from his administration and cleaning job at a parking lot. This income has to cover the cost of food, education, and basic services (water and electricity).

He is seeking a loan to be used as an investment for a project with other partners. He wishes to organize events such as artistic evenings, shows, receptions etc, which is why he needs this working capital.

Erick’s dream is to complete his professional training and have his own events business and in this way improve his income and his standard of living. This is the first time he has asked IMPRO and Kiva for a loan.

loans.use: obtain working capital for his event planning business

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad es de estado civil divorciada, cuenta con 2 hijos bajo su dependencia, uno de ellos aún se encuentra en escuela. La señora Felicidad se dedica a la venta de leche desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, su venta está destinada para la una planta industrializadora de leche, también se dedica a la producción de queso y su principal fuente de ingreso es la compra y venta de Vacas, sus mayores consumidores son de provincias muy alejadas. La señora es una persona muy responsable que lucha para la sustentación de sus hijos, trabaja en esta actividad hace 15 años, pero tuvo  que empezar de cero desde que se separó de su esposo, ya que tuvo que hacer muchos gastos y según nos cuenta el ex esposo se aprovechó de los bienes que le correspondía, por lo cual entró en una depresión terrible y se enfermó, actualmente se encuentra con muchas ganas de trabajar, por lo cual requiere de un crédito para  incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Felicidad is divorced and has two dependent children, one of whom is still in school.  Felicidad sells milk to an industrial milk plant starting very early in the morning.  She also produces cheese, but her main source of income is buying and selling cows.  Her primary customers are very distant provinces.  

Felicidad is a very responsible person who fights hard to support her children.  She has been in business for 15 years. She started out from zero when she separated from her husband because she had a lot of expenses. Plus, she says, her ex-husband went off with everything they had, so she fell into a terrible depression and took sick.  Now, though, Felicidad has a great desire to work, so she needs a loan to increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy heads of cattle.

loans.name: Djiguignouma Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguignouma, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 49 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Dibida, commune de kalake, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de céréales, des tissus la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djiguignouma sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Mariam Bouacar  la première personne à gauche des assises, est vendeuse de tomate elle compte acheter 6 paniers de tomate trois fois par semaine. La vente se fait à Bamako quartier Banankabougou. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000 FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djiguignouma, composed exclusively of married women, average 40 years of age and four children, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Dibida, in Commune de Kalake, Préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains and cloth, and they work in food service. They are on their sixth solidarity loan.

This client, Mariam Bouacar, who is the first person sitting from the left in the photo, is a vendor of tomatoes. She intends to purchase 6 baskets of tomatoes three times a week. Sales are made in Bamako, in the Banankabougou district. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 18,000 francs CFA that will be reused in her business and for meeting family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is a 55-year-old, married woman, with five children. She deals in the sale of bangles to meet her household expenses. She has been running this business for many years and she has become famous in her town for providing the best quality bangles in different colors. 

In order to inflate her sales, Mukhtaran needs to purchase a great collection of bangles in different colors and sizes. For this reason, she applied for her fourth loan to Kashf Foundation, in the amount of PKR 25,000. 

The loan will help her to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and she wishes to spend the increased earnings on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a great collection of bangles in different colors and sizes.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 26-year-old married woman. She has been running a tailoring business with her husband for five years. Ishrat is shown in the photo.

She started the tailoring business with her husband at home. During 5 years of business, her husband has analyzed the market very well and decided to expand the business. 

In this case, they have applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kiva's Partner, BRAC, to purchase a new tailoring shop in the market. Ishrat wishes to build her own house as she is living in a rental home at the moment. 

She is thankful to BRAC for its support.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring shop in the market.

loans.name: Dubán

texts.es: Dubán es un joven de 20 años de edad que trabaja en un supermercado del pueblo donde reside y vive con sus padres en una finca arrendada. Allí su padre posee 3 vacas lecheras cuya producción diaria es vendida a sus vecinos. El cliente, con su espíritu emprendedor, con su empuje y perseverancia, con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos familiares y personales, solicita el primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de 3 vacas productoras de leche para iniciar su negocio de manera independiente, aprovechar el terreno de pasto que poseen en la finca y aumentar su producción, todo esto dará como resultado el aumento en los ingresos con los que puede aportar a la economía de su hogar y seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de realizar estudios universitarios y adquirir más ganado lechero para hacer de su actividad, un negocio rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, que en un futuro le dé la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Dubán , 20, is a young man working in a supermarket in the town he lives in.  He lives with his parents on a rented farm.  His father has three dairy cows there whose daily production is sold to neighbors.  

With his enterprising spirit, drive and perseverance, Dubán wants to contribute more to personal and family income so is requesting his first loan to buy three dairy cows to start an independent business taking advantage of the pastureland he has on the farm thus increasing production.  All of this will result in increased income to contribute to household economy and continue working to reach his dream of attending university and to acquire more dairy cattle to turn his activity into a profitable, long-lasting business that in future will lead to better quality of life and well-being for him and for his family.

loans.use: to buy three dairy cows.

loans.name: Gracibell

texts.es:
La joven Gracibell es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su hija y su esposo en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad. 
Gracibell necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, cal y  leña. Los cuales  necesita para seguir elaborando su  producto. Espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento  el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Gracibell espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  su hija continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
The young Gracibell is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives with her daughter and her husband in a community in the south of Honduras. Her business is selling and making tortillas for which she is well-known in her community. 

Gracibell needs the loan for the purchase of the corn, lime, and firewood that are necessary to continue making her product. Thanks to the loan, she hopes that she will be able to have the supplies needed to continue her business, meet the demands of the customers, and have a large increase in sales, which can be reflected in the quality of life for her family at home. 

Gracibell expects her business to continue to grow and become better known in the community. In this way, she can continue supporting her family and allow her daughter to continue with her studies and have more opportunities in life.  

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2013

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Deme, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 50 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Dibida, commune de Binko, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiment,  de charbon de bois, de céréales et de la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Deme sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Sitan  la personne assise au milieu, compte acheter 5 sacs d’arachide qui seront décortiqués et vendus dans la ville de Fana. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35500 FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women of the group Deme, composed exclusively of married women, average 50 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Dibida, in Commune de Kalake, Préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, charcoal, and grains, and they work in food service. They are on their fourth solidarity loan.

This client, Sitan, who is sitting in the middle in the photo, intends to purchase 5 sacks of peanuts, which will be shelled and sold in Fana City. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 35,500 francs CFA that will be reused in her business and for covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISEME, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Dibida, commune de kalake, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment de tubercules de la farine et des céréales. 
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISEME sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises citées ci-dessus.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Sitan  1 ère debout  à gauche, est vendeuse de condiments surtout les feuilles de baobab. Elle compte acheter une dizaine de sac de baobab chaque semaine. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12000 FCFA dont une partie  sera  utilisé pour acheter une chèvre.
texts.en:
The women of the group DJIGUISEME, composed exclusively of married women, average 38 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Dibida, in Commune de Kalake, Préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, flour, and grains. They are on their sixth solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase the different merchandise cited above.

This client, Sitan, who is the first person standing from the left in the photo, is a vendor of condiments, especially of baobab leaves. She intends to purchase a dozen sacks of baobab leaves each week. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 12,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used to purchase a goat.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married 34-year-old female. She has four children: 10, 6, 4 and 1 years old respectively; which she support. Bahati, was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a Kadet officer. She has had a grocery shop (which has lasted) for five years, and it is located at Mpirani in Malindi. 

In her business, she earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. She is taking her third loan of KES 30,000, which she intends to use in adding stocks to her business, such as vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and cabbages. 

Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was paid back successfully. Bahati will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and cabbages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 32-year-old lady; her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her husband owns a furniture shop in which he manufactures wooden accessories, such as sofas and beds. Her husband has been making furniture on order for many years and feeding his family. He wants to buy fancy cloths for making sofas, but some of his debtors did not pay their debts yet. He is in urgent need to buy the fancy cloths so he can complete his task on time.
 
Therefore, Sajida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy fancy cloths for making sofa set. 

Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy fancy cloths for making sofa sets.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz is a 29-year-old woman and a mother of five children. She is doing a business of animal purchasing and sales for the last two years. Currently, she has two buffaloes and two goats. 

With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business to lead them to a decent life. Riaz purchases baby cows and goats from the local market at a wholesale rate and then sells them to the people in her community. She is working hard to meet her daily household expenses. 

Riaz has requested a loan of PKR 30,000/- to buy more baby goats, to expand her business. She is currently in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and she has a good credit history. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her income by targeting more customers. 

Riaz hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats.

loans.name: Manzoran

texts.en:
Manzoran, age 53, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market, at higher prices. She has one buffalo, one cow and two goats. She makes enough money through her business to contribute to the family's income.  

Manzoran is a mother of two. She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase one more goat. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase one more goat.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 26-year-old vigorous, married lady. She has been running a business of selling milk with her husband (who is also shown in the photo) for a year. They have two buffaloes to milk, and they sell their milk to many of their neighbors. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting the milk from them, while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis.

They are happily doing it together to support their family. They have two children, one of them is school going. They need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing, and education. 

In order to make huge profits, Zareena has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy one more buffalo to carter to more customers. They hope to get an increase in production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Olta

texts.en:
Olta is 25 years old and lives in a village in southeastern Albania where she has been operating a hair salon for five years. “I am busy because I serve all the villages around and, gladly, there is a large population in our region. Almost every family here has been blessed with more than five children, let alone grandchildren,” said Olta, smiling. She is soon to become a mother, herself.

The reason why she needs this loan is that she wants to add another service. Olta wants to rent out bridal dresses and do some renovation of the salon to fit the purpose. Olta offers home bridal makeup, as well.

loans.use: to buy bridal dresses for rental.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman, with three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over six years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es: La familia de María De La Luz se ha dedicado a la producción de café desde hace muchos años y fue su padre quien le enseñí a ella todo lo relacionado con este cultivo. En la cosecha pasada María De La Luz tuvo una producción de 10 toneladas y ella espera aumentar a 13 toneladas en un lapso de 3 años. Para que esto sea posible ella resembró parte de su cafetal y ahora solicita un crédito para comprar fertilizantes y pagar a cortadores de café.
texts.en: María De La Luz’s family has grown coffee for many years and it was her father who taught her everything related to this crop. Last season, María De La Luz produced 10 tons and she hopes to increase her production to 13 tons in three years. For this to be possible, she has planted new trees and is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and hire coffee pickers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hire coffee pickers.

loans.name: Raul Alfonzo

texts.es:
Raul es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja como auxiliar de sistemas en una empresa de su ciudad, con lo cual apoya en algunos gastos del hogar, ya que vive con sus padres, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo por su responsabilidad y honradez.

Raul está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres, así seguirá luchando para poder realizar su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Raul is a young man eager to get ahead which is why he puts such effort and dedication in his work as a computer support assistant in a business in his city, which provides for some household expenses since he still lives with his parents. He believes that he is doing well in his work because of his responsibility and his honesty. 

Raul is grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have provided, he can buy building materials for home improvements and improve the quality of life for his parents while continuing to realize his great dream to have his own house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Thomas from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. He is married with one child, 11 years of age. He began this business because he wanted to create a permanent source of income to take care of his family.

Thomas runs a general stock business; he sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits and soaps. He has been running this business since after the rebel war. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. He says that the main challenge to his business is the slow purchasing power of customers.

Thomas has requested a loan in order to purchase items, such as drinks, cigarette, pure water and mayonnaise. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his child school fees and buy a plot of land. In the future, He plans to become an agent of provision and cigarette seller. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items, such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor district, Kompong Cham province, Non is 24 years old and she is able to earn a daily income by planting seasonal crops. She has been in the farming business for over ten years. 

Non has a life partner, Lav, who is in the same business. Together, they can generate a net profit of approximately of USD 8 per day for supporting the whole family. After being married for many years, they have given birth to a young child who still depends on their slight income. 

Currently, their living condition is a bit of a sanitation concern since they still do not have a personal latrine for their family’s use, but they don’t have enough money to make it possible to get one.

That is the reason why Non would like to ask for loan from Kiva, through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), for the purpose of building a new latrine. Also, with the remaining funds, Non will dig a well in front of her house to get enough water for their consumption, especially in the dry season, which will last for six months of the year, starting in November and continuing until April. These Kiva funds can make her life better and more comfortable.

loans.use: to build a latrine and dig a well for water.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 34-year-old, married woman and a mother of five. She is a hard-working mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past three years. She well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough money to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Shabana requested for a loan of PKR 25,000/- to buy a stock of thread in different colors, along with packs of buttons and laces. In addition to repaying the loan, Shabana will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiseme, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 48 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Zanfina, commune de Binko, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié..                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiseme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises.                                                                                                                
La cliente Moussocoura  la deuxième personne debout à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 30 sacs de charbon de bois seront vendus à Bamako. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20000 FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Djiguiseme group, who are all married women, average 48 years of age with three children each and all live in extended traditional families in the village of Zanfina, in the Binko municipality, which lies in the Baroueli prefecture in the Ségou region (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through relationships as relatives, neighbors and friends. 

The women in the Djirguiseme group are on their first group loan which will be used to buy various goods.

Moussocoura, who is standing second from the left in the photo, is planning to buy 30 sacks of charcoal which will be sold in Bamako. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and for family expenses.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy de 63 años de edad habita al sur de la ciudad y en su condición de mujer separada de su esposo debió acudir a generar ingresos suficientes para su hogar, así fue como desde el año 1983 decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercancías para lograr apoyar el bienestar de sus 5 hijos, hoy en las edades de 28 a 39 años. Con su negocio ha salido adelante con su núcleo familiar pues distribuye por encargos sabanas, cubrelechos, ropa y artículos que sus clientela le solicita, haciéndole a cada uno de ellos un plan de pagos ajustados a sus necesidades. En un 100% sus ventas las realiza a crédito, con una frecuencia quincenal, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa para habitaciones y para damas. Con esta inversión proyecta que su negocio esté surtido y ella pueda cumplir efectivamente los pedidos de su clientela
texts.en: Nancy is 63-years-old and lives in the south of the city. She is separated from her husband and must generate sufficient income for her household. In 1983, she decided to pursue selling merchandise to support the well-being of her five children now between the ages of 28 and 39 years. With this business, she has been able to move forward with her immediate family selling sheets, comforters, and clothing to her clients’ orders, offering each a payment plan tailored to their needs. 100% of her sales are made on credit in two weeks cycles working from 8 am to 4 pm. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy women's clothing and bedclothes. With this investment, she projects that her business will expand its selection and she can effectively implement her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to purchase bedclothes and women's clothing

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiseme, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Dibida, commune de kalake, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de céréales et de la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiseme sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Paye la deuxième personne à gauche, est vendeuse de bouillie elle compte acheter 1 sac de mil et un demi sac de sucre. Elle prépare  de la bouillie qui sera vendu dans la village. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35500 FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Djiguiseme group, who are all married women, average 35 years of age with three children each and all live in extended traditional families in the village of Dibida, in the Kalake municipality, which lies in the Baroueli prefecture in the Ségou region (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through relationships as relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade in cereals and carry out restauration businesses.

The women in the Djirguiseme group are on their sixth group loan.

The customer, Paye, who is second from the left in the photo, sells "bouillie" (a type of porridge) and is planning to buy a sack of millet and half a sack of sugar. She makes the porridge and sells it in the village. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,500FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and for family expenses.

loans.use: to buy millet and sugar for restauration activity.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos se ha dedicado a la producción de café desde hace algunos años. Fue su padre quien le enseñó todo lo relacionado con este cultivo y además le heredó un terreno para que pudiera trabajar. PAra esta cosecha Juan Carlos necesita comprar fertilizantes para sus plantas de café para que crezcan fuertes y den producto de buena calidad. Además de dedicarse a la producción de café Juan Carlos trabaja en unas oficinas para de esta manera obtener ingresos extra para su familia, pues está casado y tiene un hijo de 3 años.
texts.en: Juan Carlos has worked in coffee production for a number of years. It was his father who taught him everything having to do with this crop and additionally left him a plot of land so that he could work.  For this harvest, Juan Carlos needs to buy fertilizers for his coffee plants so that they grow strong and produce a high quality product.  Besides working in coffee production, Juan Carlos works in some offices. In this way he can earn extra income for his family, since he is married and has a three-year-old child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
La Señora Julieta tiene un hijo;es procuradora, realiza todo tipo de trámites, vive  en anticrético con su hijo, en la zona de Escobar Uria de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de una laptop, pues es muy necesaria para su actividad diaria y así mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo.

El sueño de Julieta  es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para dejar de vivir en anticrético y mejorar el nivel de vida en su familia.
Esta es la segunda vez que su credito se canaliza a traves de Kiva.
texts.en:
Julieta has children.  She’s a solicitor and does all types of transactions.  She lives with her son in the ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] modality in the city of La Paz’s Escobar Uría zone.

She needs the loan to buy a laptop because it’s quite necessary for her daily activity and it will improve her working conditions.  Julieta’s dream is to gather enough money to stop living in ‘anticrético’ and improve her family’s standard of living.  This is the second time her loan has been channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham, de 24 años de edad es un hombre responsable y muy trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá e hijo Franklin a quien cuida en la casa donde lo criaron desde niño. A muy temprana edad asumió la responsabilidad de criar a su hija a la que quiere mucho. Su actividad económica se centra en la agricultura, desde muy temprano se dirige a los terrenos agrícolas que posee en la zona alta de su localidad, donde todas las mañanas se dirige para cuidar de sus cultivos de maíz, alverja y papa en pocas ocasiones, pues en sus inicios tuvo muchas dificultades con la producción del tubérculo, ya que tiende mucho a coger plagas y el precio en el mercado en bajo. Es así que durante muchos años de experiencia pudo tener un negocio estable y ahora con las ganancias que tiene con la venta de sus alimentos a la capital, pudo comprar un motocarro, con el que puede tener un ingreso extra.    Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad económica, pues le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Abraham, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Abraham, 24, is a responsible, very hardworking man living with his mother and son, Franklin, who he cares for in the house he grew up in.  At a very young age he took on the responsibility of caring for his daughter who he loves very much.  

His economic activity centers on agriculture.  He heads to his fields located in the uplands of his locality very early in the morning to care for his corn, pea and potato crops.  At the beginning he had many difficulties growing the tuber because it’s prone to infestations and market price is low.  

With many years’ experience he succeeded in establishing a stable business and was able to use profits from selling his foodstuffs in the capital to buy a car that produces extra income.

This will be his second Kiva loan.  He’s grateful for the economic opportunity for it will help him improve his income.  He therefore promises to be punctual with his installment payments.  Abraham will use the 1,500 soles to buy organic manure to spread among his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Berta Inés

texts.es: Berta, a sus 47 años de edad, es casada y madre de 5 hijos. Desde hace aproximadamente 3 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente vendiendo mercancía por catálogo, actividad que inició con el ánimo de generar ingresos por cuenta propia para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para poder estar al cuidado de su familia. La cliente es una persona humilde, luchadora y siempre se esfuerza para lograr sus objetivos, lo que le ha permitido sobrepasar diferentes obstáculos, especialmente con la competencia que tiene en el sector, pues existen muchas personas que venden este tipo de productos, sin embargo, ella ha sabido llevar la situación y ha salido adelante. Solicita el apoyo del cuarto crédito para pagar el saldo del crédito que tiene vigente y el resto de dinero invertirlo en la compra de mercancía (accesorios, perfumería, cosméticos, productos de aseo, entre otros), con el fin de aprovechar las promociones y descuentos que le ofrecen, lo que le permitirá abastecerse de una variedad de artículos para satisfacer la demanda de la temporada navideña que se aproxima, así podrá mejorar sus ventas y tendrá mayor nivel de ingresos. Berta sueña con fortalecer su negocio, hacer que esta actividad sea rentable y aumentar su clientela, de esta forma desea continuar generando recursos económicos suficientes para aportar a las finanzas del hogar y tener la oportunidad de brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida favorables.
texts.en:
Berta, age 47, is married and has five children.  She has been working as an independent merchant for approximately three years.  She sells merchandise by catalog, a business activity that she started with the intention of generating income on her own.  She also did this to help her husband with the financial responsibility of the household and to be able to take care of her family.

Berta is a humble and tenacious person.  She always puts forth great effort in order to achieve her objectives.  This allows her to overcome different obstacles, especially with the competition that she has in the area.  There are a lot of people who sell these types of products.  Nevertheless, she has known how to manage the situation, and she has gotten ahead.

She is requesting the support of her fourth loan in order to pay the balance of her current loan.  She will use the rest of the money to buy merchandise (accessories, perfume, cosmetics, and hygiene products, among others).  She will do this in order to take advantage of the sales and discounts being offered.  This will allow her to stock up on a variety of items to satisfy the demand of the Christmas season that is coming.  This way she will be able to improve her sales, and she will have a greater level of income. 

Berta dreams of strengthening her business, of making this business activity profitable, and of increasing her clientele.  This way she wishes to continue generating enough financial resources to contribute to the household finances.  She also wishes to have the opportunity to give her family a better state of well-being and favorable life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the balance of her existing loan and to buy merchandise (accessories, perfume, cosmetics, and hygiene products, among others).

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Elizabeth es peluquera, se dedica a ofrecer servicios de peluquería a domicilio, vive en anticretico con su hijo, en la zona de Escobar Uria de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo necesita para incrementar de su capital, adquiriendo insumos por mayor (como ser tintes,developers,cremas para el cabello)para obtener beneficios en la reducción de costos y  de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Elizabeth es poder comprar su casa propia brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Elizabeth’s a barber and provides services at customers’ homes.  She and her son live in the city of La Paz’s Escobar Uría zone in the ‘anticrético’ modality.  [transaction hereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you].

She needs the loan to increase her capital purchasing supplies at wholesale (hair dye, developers and creams) to have the benefit of lower prices leading to higher profits.  

Elizabeth’s dream is to be able to buy a house of her own and to provide her family with better living conditions.  This is the second time her loan is channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La Señora Esperanza  es comerciante, sigue con su negocio de venta todo tipo de telas, vive en casa propia, en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo  requiere para el aumento de capital para comprar más telas, pues tiene muchos pedidos y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Esperanza es poder vender sus productos por mayor y asi ampliar su negocio.
esta es la segunda vez que su crédito va a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Esperanza’s a merchant and continues with her business selling all types of fabric.  She lives in a house of her own in the city of La Paz’s Miraflores zone.  

She needs the loan to increase capital purchasing more fabric because she has many pending orders and she can increase her income this way.  Her dream is to be able to become a wholesaler thus expanding her business.  This is the second time her loan is by means of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en:
Juliette is a 51-year-old widow, mother of six children. A year and a half ago, after her husband passed away, Juliette started her own business, specializing in embroidery, souvenirs, and clothes. 

Her main aim was to cover her family's needs, especially her children's education fees which are very important to her since she had the chance to reach the intermediate classes because of her family's financial situation. Her business is going just fine, although she has a short period in the market, but she proved to be skillful in her domain, which attracts customers' attention.

Juliette is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to change her shop's decorations, to keep it attracting customers' attention. She might also use part of the loan to buy necessary embroidery needs to expand her business.

She hopes that, one day, her customers will increase, which is the main target she is working on achieving, and then move to a larger shop in the future.

loans.use: to change her shop's decorations.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 28 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Eduardo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores, a los que cuida en la casa que heredaron de sus padres. Sus terrenos se encuentran a una hora de distancia del pueblo, por ello construyeron su casita muy cerca para cuidar sus terrenos agrícolas y sus sembríos, los cuales constan de papa y maíz. Aún no cuentan con terrenos propios, por eso alquilan extensas áreas por un año de esa manera ya no se preocupan de pagar el arriendo de manera mensual. Junto a sus esposo cuida, fertilizan y riegan sus sembríos, los dos trabajan, pues ambos toman decisiones importantes acerca de sus cultivos. “En la cosecha, viajamos a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde vendemos nuestros alimentos”, comenta. Mientras cuida de sus sembríos, pasta a sus animales entre cerdos y ovejas, que le sirven como alimento, la vida en el campo le gusta mucho, por continuará trabajando y ahorrando para comprar su propia casa. Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA, espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Rosa, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico, para nutrir su próxima siembra de maíz y demás productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 28, is an unassuming woman.  She lives with her husband, Eduardo.  They have three minor children whom they take care of in the house inherited from her parents.  Their land is one hour from the town.  Therefore, they built a small house very nearby in order to take care of their farm land and their plants, which consist of potatoes and corn.  They still do not have their own land; that is why they rent extensive areas for one year.  This way they do not have to worry about paying the rent monthly.

Together with her husband she cares for, fertilizes, and waters their plants.  The two of them work, and both of them make important decisions having to do with their crops.  “During the harvest we travel to the city of Huancayo where we sell our food,” she says.  While she takes care of their plants she grazes their animals, pigs and sheep, which serve as food.  She really likes rural life.  She will continue working and saving in order to buy her own house.

This is her third loan with Kiva.  She hopes for a small loan in order to meet her objectives.  She pledges, one more time, to make her payments.  Rosa will use the 1,500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her next planting of corn and other agricultural products.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: La Primavera Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LA PRIMAVERA,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Mary tiene 34 años y dos hijos  de las edades de 4 y 7 años,  su actividad económica es venta frutas según a la temporada, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace 10 años, el destino del crédito es para la compra fruta de la temporada por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta, la Sra. Mary es una persona trabajadora, ya que esta es única fuente de ingresos, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le han brindado, ella tiene su puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la zona central, el deseo de la Sra. Mary es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos como también incrementar su clientela para generar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The “La Primavera” (Spring) communal bank consists of 8 members, six women and two men.  The bank president is Mary, 34.  She has two children aged 4 and 7.  Her economic activity is selling seasonal fruit.  She’s been in this occupation for ten years and the loan will be used to buy seasonal fruit at wholesale to stock her stand.  Mary is a hardworking woman who is the only source of income and feels grateful to the institution for the support it’s provided her.  Her fruit stand is in one of the central zone’s markets and Mary hopes to have a store where she can offer a variety of products and increase her clientele to generate higher income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo está soltero pero tiene una niña de 10 años, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de sopocachi de La Ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja en una Institucion donde percibe un sueldo con el cual se mantiene y paga las pensiones de su hija.Tambien se dedica a la venta de equipos informaticos con lo cual genera mas ingresos

El credito que solicita es para pagar el ultimo curso de su carrera que es Ingeniería en Sistemas y de esta manera poder acceder a un cargo mejor en la Institución donde trabaja

Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is single but has a 10-year-old daughter.  He lives in his parents’ house in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone. He currently works in an institution earning a salary that supports him and provides his daughter’s support stipends.  He also works selling computer supplies to earn extra income.

The loan he’s requesting is to pay tuition for his final Systems Engineering course to be eligible to access better job positions in the firm he works for.  This is the third time he’s worked with IMRPO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan  vive con su esposa en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz y tienen tres hijos. La pareja se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una tienda en su mismo domicilio; este ingreso lo utilizan para el diario vivir. Juan necesita el crédito para poder construir un baño en el piso en el que vive y de esta manera mejorar el nivel de vida que tiene en su hogar. Necesita comprar azulejos, taza de baño, lavamanos, cemento y otros para dicha construcción.

El sueño de Juan es dejar a sus hijos en condiciones de poder subsistir en la sociedad obteniendo de esta manera un nivel de vida aceptable.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta zone; they have three children.  The couple works selling basic staple items in a store located at home.  They use the income for daily living.

Juan needs the loan to be able to build a bathroom at home to improve the standard of living there.  He needs to buy tile, a bathtub, a sink, cement and other supplies to build it.

Juan’s dream is to leave his children in condition to be able to subsist in society and attain an acceptable standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en: Zubeda is 57 years old and lives in Changamwe area near Mombasa, Kenya. She sells cooked food at a shopping centre near where she lives. She has been in the business for the past five years. She is a wife and a mother of five children. Some of the children are old enough to feed themselves. Two of her children are still in school and she has to pay school fees for them. She knew Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy flour, beans, and cooking oil for her business. This business is the only source of income for her, and she works every day to make sure that her business succeeds. The challenge that she has been facing is raising funds to boost her business. The extra income that she will earn will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Amri

texts.en:
Nearly two decades after a tragic genocide devastated Rwanda, the nation has made great strides to recovery and has become of the most business-friendly countries in Africa. Yet it is still one of the poorest countries in Africa, with an average household income of just $1.45 per day. Nearly 80% of Rwanda’s population lives in its mountainous rural terrain. The Global Alliance for Clean Cookstoves estimates that over 8.5 million people in Rwanda are affected by household air pollution caused by cooking over open fires.  

The Paradigm Project has long been passionate about working in Rwanda to help alleviate the burden on household finances and health that is caused by cooking over open fires. We launched our EzyLife brand in Rwanda in 2012 in anticipation of finding a great business partner whom we could work with to build a local EzyLife business. 

We first met Amri, who founded SERVE and SMILE to help bring life-improving products to the people of Rwanda, when he joined our campaign to pilot a market-based system for delivering cookstoves and solar lights to rural Rwanda. After nearly a year of working together, we are delighted to help Amri launch his own business in Rwanda with a Kiva loan that will purchase 2,880 cookstoves.

“This loan will make our company dream comes true by stepping to the bottom of the pyramid as we are solving problems of the poor at the same time creating jobs in rural areas, mostly to women entrepreneurs (village agents),” said Amri when he heard about the Kiva loan opportunity. 

Amri will launch his business in partnership with two unique groups: he will work with CARE, an international non-profit organization that is working with EzyLife to train 100 women entrepreneurs in rural areas who will do direct sales of Amri’s cookstoves. He will also work with a vast network of community groups supporting survivors of the genocide, also helping to recruit and train women as cookstove entrepreneurs and sales agents. Through these two groups, there is already vast demand for the product – Amri is worried about having enough stoves to serve everyone in need! With this Kiva loan, he will be able to purchase enough stoves to satisfy the growing demand and sell them at a profit so that he can continue to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy clean cookstoves to sell to women's groups

loans.name: Eldi

texts.es: La Sra. Eldi, tiene 28 años, casada con un hijo que tiene la edad de seis años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de repostería como pan y variedad de queques , su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la localidad de Santa Rita,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Eldi va a usar este préstamo para la compra de  un horno industrial de mayor capacidad ya quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, La Sra. Eldi con este crédito mejorara sus ganancias, La Sra. Eldi es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Eldi, 28, lives with her six-year-old son.  She works making and selling a variety of pastries like bread and assorted cakes.  Her bakery is located in Santa Rita.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Eldi will use it to buy an high capacity industrial oven because she wants to increase production and meet customer demand.

Eldi’s profits will improve with the loan.  She’s a person who very much wants to improve and feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provides since this is the only activity she has to support herself with.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven.

loans.name: Grisel Rocio

texts.es: La Sra. Grisel  tiene 41 años tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 15 y ocho años que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos como ropa, zapatillas y distintos productos según a pedido, ella  entrega a distintos  puestos de venta y domicilios, ya que le hacen pedidos ella entrega sus productos a crédito, este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución, la Sra. Grisel  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de juegos de sabana y ropa por mayor ya que tiene muchos pedidos, la Sra. Grisel  ,  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención con la compra de variedad de productos, la Sra. Grisel  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Grisel, 41, has two children aged 15 and 8 who are school age.  She’s a retail merchant selling a variety of goods like clothes, sandals, various products to order.  She sells to various sales points and to homes since her orders for products are on credit.  

This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Grisel will use it to buy bed linen sets and clothes at wholesale because she has many pending orders.  Grisel’s business challenge is demand for new products and she will use profits to buy more products to provide better service.  Grisel feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided by granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario, tiene 47 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Alto Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosario va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada al por mayor como faldas y vestidos ya que se acerca la época de calor, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Rosario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar mercadería, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Rosario se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario, 47, works selling seasonal clothing in her stand located in the Alto Pampahasi zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Rosario will use it to buy seasonal clothes like skirts and dresses at wholesale for the hot season is approaching and sales and orders increase then.  Her reason for requesting this loan is the lack of  capital.  

The business challenge Rosario faces is daily competition.  She will use profits to buy merchandise.  Her wish for her business is to have a wide variety of merchandise on hand to offer her customers.  Rosario feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided for it makes it possible for her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La Sra. Maritza  tiene 23 años, casada con un hijito de la edad de dos años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá transportarse para realizar algunas compras para su negocio, la Sra. Maritza  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias personas que se dedican a la venta de comida, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una restaurante para poder brindar comodidad a su clientela y  así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Maritza, 23, is married with a two-year-old son.  She works selling food in her stand located in El Torno.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and she’ll use it to buy a motorcycle that will help her get around to make some purchases for her business.  Maritza’s business challenge is competition because there are several people who sell food.  Her wish for her business is to continue selling and to have a restaurant to provide comfort for her customers and thus make her business grow and improve her income leading to better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo tiene 26 años, tiene dos hijos de las edade3s de 3 y un años, el tiene la actividad de transporte de pasajeros en la localidad de el Torno el es moto taxista,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Wilfredo va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una  motocicleta  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Wilfredo va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando repuestos y si se puede otra motocicleta, El Sr. Wilfredo   es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse, el deseo del Sr. Wilfredo es tener una tienda donde pueda vender motocicletas ya que esta es una nueva actividad en la que esta incursionado.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 26, has two children aged 3 and 1.  His activity is providing passenger transport services in El Torno; he’s a mototaxi driver.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and Wilfredo will use it to buy a motorcycle to provide better customer service and increase profits.  His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving his business.

Wilfredo will use profits to continue buying spare parts and if possible another motorcycle.  Wilfredo is a very hardworking man who feels happy for the opportunity being provided since his is the only activity he has to support himself.  His wish is to have a store where he can sell motorcycles since this is a new activity he’s going into.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Voxji village of Shirak region. She lives with her ten-year-old son and eight-year-old daughter. 

Anna has been a school teacher for many years. The teachers' salary, however, is so low, that she cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. Anna is also engaged in breeding livestock of cows and sheep, in beekeeping and in cultivation of wheat, potatoes, apples and pears. Anna is very hard-working and takes the initiative to do a variety of things to earn a living for her family. 

Anna currently needs to find more sources of income to be able to meet the needs of her family. A loan of USD 1,200 will be a huge support to Anna and will enable her to purchase wheat and barley seeds, to buy some forage for the livestock, to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery and to pay for harvesting services. 

Anna relies on the good will of the lenders and will be very grateful to them for helping her sustain her agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and barley seeds, to buy some forage for livestock, to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en:
Musarrat is a 31-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Mussarrat has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house for the past 5 years. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market where he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Musarrat wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet increasing demand at her store. She is expecting to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

Mussarrat is currently in her 4th loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation and shows good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Lucero De Fátima

texts.es: Lucero es una mujer campesina de 37 años de edad que vive con su esposo y su único hijo de 10 años. Hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica a elaborar alimentos desde su casa, trabaja sola dos días a la semana y la producción es comercializada en diferentes estaderos y cafeterías del sector, de esta forma obtiene los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Su empuje y dedicación le han dado la oportunidad de ser reconocida en la zona y tener una amplia trayectoria en el mercado. Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (nevera y estufa industrial) así mejorará las condiciones de trabajo, tendrá más comodidad, disminuirá el tiempo del proceso de elaboración, permitiendo el aumento de la producción, además podrá almacenar los insumos y los productos terminados. Todo esto se  verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y por ende los ingresos que le genera esta actividad. Lucero desea continuar trabajando arduamente para fortalecer su negocio, elaborando productos de muy buena calidad y así tener la oportunidad de incrementar su clientela, esto le dará la opción de percibir mejores ingresos y podrá brindar a su hijo una mejor educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucero is a 37-year-old country woman who lives with her husband and their only child, a ten-year-old boy. She has been working making food from her home for approximately eight years. She works on her own two days per week and sells her products to different restaurants and cafes in the area. This allows her to obtain the income necessary to help her husband support their household. Her drive and dedication have given her the opportunity of becoming well known in her area and of achieving a growing market trajectory. 

Her motivation to request this loan is the purpose of investing it in purchasing fixed assets (refrigerator and industrial cooking range) to improve her working conditions. She will work more comfortably and reduce production time, which will allow for increased production. She will also be able to store ingredients and the finished food products. All of this will result in an increase in sales and, in turn, increased income from her business. 

Lucero wants to keep working hard to strengthen her business by making very high quality products. This will afford her the chance to increase her customer base and to access higher income in order to give her son a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fixed assets (refrigerator and industrial cooking range).

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is a married woman and the mother of five children: three in school, one adult and one underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past three years, she has operated a kiosk, selling food to neighbors and passersby. She says price fluctuations are her major challenge, and dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. She is requesting a loan for KSHS 10,000 to buy salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets to resell. She decided to join Yehu as a way to secure financial support.

loans.use: to buy various food items to resell.

loans.name: Buya

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Buya from Waterloo, which is east of Freetown. He is married with two children, ages 7 months and 3 years. 

Buya runs a general store. He sells drinks and cement. He began this business because he wants to create a permanent source of income to support himself and his wife. He has been running this business for 7 years. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

Buya has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes and cement. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installment and have his daily meal. In the future, he plans to open another shop. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes and cement.

loans.name: Shazan

texts.en:
Shazan, 35 years old, has been buying and selling animals with her husband for many years. She has two buffalo, one cow and nine goats, selling their milk as a secondary source of income. She takes care of the livestock while her husband sells them to neighbors and in the local market. 

Shazan has six children but is able to send only four of them to school due to financial constraints. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday needs including food, clothing and education. 

In order to make larger profits, Shazan is requesting her third loan of Rs 20,000/- to buy another buffalo. She dreams of providing all her children with a good quality education and the opportunity for a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 31 años, esta casada con Percy, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 1 años. Ellos habitan una casa alquilada.Jessica es una joven alegre y de gran actitud para el trabajo. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a los tejidos de prendas de vestir como gorras, chalinas y chompas de lanas sintéticas, de ovejas, alpacas y otros. Considera que su actividad es rentable, ya que su distrito se caracteriza por la gran afluencia de turistas nacionales y extranjeros, quienes llegan hasta esa parte del país para adquirir las más bellas artesanías. “Los tejidos son lo que más vendo, cada quincena envío un a gran parte hasta Lima y otras ciudades, porque tengo pedidos”, menciona. En estos años de artesana, ha perfeccionado sus técnicas de tejidos, ya que innova constantemente en los diseños. Le gusta su trabajo y lo califica como una labor que le permitirá crecer como empresaria, por ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirir más mercaderías. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues mejorará su ingreso económico, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Jessica, invertirá los S/.300 soles en la compra de lana de diversos colores para continuar con sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Jessica, 31, is married to Percy and they have two children who are 6 and 1 years old.  They live in a rented house.  Jessica’s a cheerful young woman with a great attitude towards work.  For over six years she’s been knitting articles of clothing like caps, scarves and sweaters using synthetic yarn, sheep’s wool, alpaca and others.  She considers her work to be profitable because her district is noted for a high incidence of tourists and foreigners who come to this part of the country to buy the most beautiful crafts.  “Knits are what I sell the most.  I send a great part of them to Lima and other cities every two weeks because I have orders,” she mentions.

During these years as a craftswoman, she’s perfected her knitting techniques and is constantly innovating her designs.  She likes her work and classifies it as work that will lead to her growth as a businesswoman which is why she needs your support to buy more merchandise.

This is her second Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the financial support for she will improve her income.  She therefore promises to be punctual with her payments.  Jessica will use the 300 soles to buy yarn in various colors to continue with her knitting.

loans.use: to buy assorted colored yarn.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma, de 46 años vive en su casa propia. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Glicer y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes ama. Su negocio esta ubicado en el centro artesanal del poblado, ella está convencida que la variedad de sus productos incrementarán sus ventas, es por eso que se esmera mucho en no repetir modelos.
