Además de tener buenos ingresos con la venta de sus propias creaciones. “Mi esposo me ayuda en la confección de tapices y mantas”, menciona Enma, “mientras yo me dedico al tejido con palitos de manera”. Además de ser lo que más le agrada de su trabajo, según cuenta mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, además de esta forma puede pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos, lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus artesanías hasta su puesto de venta, ya que vive muy lejos de ahí. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues mejorará su ingreso económico, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Enma, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de mercadería como: tapices, lanas y demás productos para su tienda artesanal.
texts.en:
Emma, 46, lives in her own house.  She’s noted for being a very unassuming, hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Glicer, and their two beloved children who she loves.  

Her business is located in the town’s crafts center.  She’s convinced that  variety of her goods will increase her sales which is why she strives to make unique, one-of-a-kind designs.  In addition to earning good income from selling her own creations, Emma mentions that her husband helps her to make tapestries and blankets while she knits with wooden knitting needles.  This is what she likes best about her work and she says that the more she does it the better she feels.  In addition, she’s able to pay for her minor children’s  schooling this way.  

She’s been in this business for 20 years and considers the most difficult part toting her crafts to her sales stand because she lives far away from it.  This is her 4th Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the financial support received because she will improve her income.  She therefore promises to be punctual with her payments.  Emma will use the 500 soles to buy merchandise like tapestries, yarn and other products for her crafts shop.

loans.use: to buy tapestries, yarn and other supplies.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Collana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE COLLANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Remigia ella es casada y tiene 51 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de cuyes, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia también se dedica al negocio de agricultura la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva papa y maíz, por medios de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para cuyes.
El socio que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Santa Rosa de Collana, which is located in Cusco district, within the province and department of Cusco. 

Member Remigia is married. She is 51 years old and has six children. This member has a business raising Guinea pigs. She fattens them and sells them at the different markets when they are grown. She also works farming. She has a plot of land where she grows potatoes and corn. These businesses allow her to provide for her children. Her dream is to have a retail space where she could sell her Guinea pigs. She is requesting this loan to buy Guinea pigs and Guinea pig feed. 

The member attached to the group photo had his picture taken after the meeting. He had requested leave because of work.
 
The other members work in businesses selling food, providing taxi services, a grocery store, and raising animals. 

Member Remigia is thankful to everyone who shares her dream by making these resources available, and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs and Guinea pig feed.

loans.name: Marquesa

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Marquesa en su actividad comercial, pues con su anterior credikiva pudo comprar pulseras, aretes, ropa infantil ropa interior, esmaltes, labiales y muchos artículos, que sus clientela requerían. Ella con esta inversión en mayor volumen, pudo lograr  un gran descuento. Su negocio se amplió y ahora atiende desde un local ubicado muy cerca a su domicilio.  En la actualidad, está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, para comprar materiales de ferretería, herramientas, bombillos lámparas, cables de electricidad, accesorios para baños y cocinas,  tornillería y papelería. Con todo esto que le esta pasando a su negocio: Marquesa dice de sus financiadores de Kiva  “Gracias a ellos nos beneficiamos de todas las oportunidades y que sigan cosechando”
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Marquesa in her retail trade, because with her previous Kiva loan she was able to buy bracelets, earrings, children’s clothing, underwear, nail polish, lipsticks, and many items that her customers wanted.  She was able to get a good discount with the bulk purchase. Her business grew, and now she works on it from a shop located very near her home. Currently, she is applying for new funding to buy hardware supplies, tools, light bulbs, electric cables, bathroom and kitchen accessories, nuts and bolts, and stationery. With everything that is happening to her business, Marquesa says to her Kiva lenders: “Thanks to them we take advantage of every opportunity. May they keep on reaping.”

loans.use: to buy hardware supplies, tools, lightbulbs, electric cables, bathroom and kitchen accessories, nuts and bolts, and stationery

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se siente satisfecha con los resultados que tuvo con la inversión anterior, por lo que hoy está optando por otro préstamo para surtir más su venta de frutas y verduras. Comprara naranjas, guineos, manzanas, tomates, papas, aguacates, etc., para fortalecer su negocio.
El negocio es más popular, sus clientes están más satisfechos por la calidad y variedad de productos que hoy ofrece, sus ganancias han aumentado. La alimentación para su familia es mejor, se encuentran muy saludables, su familia sigue con el mismo número de miembros.
texts.en:
María feels satisfied with the results she got from her previous loan so she’s requesting another one now to stock up on more fruit and vegetables. She will buy oranges, bananas, apples, tomatoes, potatoes, avocados, etc. to strengthen her business.

The business is more popular, her customers are more satisfied due to the quality and variety of goods she sells now and her profits have increased. Her family’s nutrition is better and they are very healthy; her family continues with the same number of members.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Benita Albertina

texts.es: Benita vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de frutas y cítricos como por ejemplo naranjas, limones, mandarinas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar piñas y naranjas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Benita lives in the city of Pilcopata, in Kosñipata district, Paucartambo province, department of Cusco, Peru. 

Her main business is selling fruit and citrus, such as oranges, lemons, tangerines, and others. This time she is requesting a loan in order to buy pineapples and oranges. 

She is grateful and appreciates this loan and promises to pay her monthly installments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy pineapples and oranges.

loans.name: Candelaria De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Candelaria es una madre soltera muy trabajadora y responsable, vive junto a sus tres hijos quienes son su mayor inspiración para salir adelante. Candelaria desde hace muchos años que desea poder construir un muro perimetral en la parte trasera de su casa, lo cual hasta la fecha por falta de recurso le había sido imposible, pero ahora gracias al préstamo otorgado por FUSAI podrá invertir en la compra de materiales como: ladrillo, cemento y hierro para realzar la construcción del muro de su hogar, lo que le permitirá sentirse más segura en su casa junto a su familia.
texts.en: Candelaria is a hardworking and responsible single mother. She lives with her three children, who are her greatest motivation to go on. For many years, Candelaria has wanted to build a wall at the back of her home, but this has been impossible due to a lack of resources. Now, however, thanks to the loan she received from FUSAI, she will be able to purchase the necessary materials, such as bricks, cement and iron, to build the wall which will help her family to feel safer in their home.

loans.use: To buy building materials for a wall around her home.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, desde hace 8 años.
Doña Margarita se desplaza en los diversos lugares cercanos a su municipio para ofrecer sus productos. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de bananos, aguacates, tomates, plátanos, sandias, melones, etc. y poder seguir realizando su trabajo.
Doña Margarita con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y espera poder  mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña Margarita espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
Margarita is a very hard worker and a very responsible person. She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her family. She has been in business selling fruit for eight years. 

Margarita travels to different nearby areas to offer her products. She needs this loan to buy bananas, avocados, tomatoes, plantains, watermelon, melon, etc. to keep doing her job. Margarita expects her sales to increase with this loan, which will be of great help to her because she doesn't have the products necessary to cover her customers' daily orders. She hopes to be able to improve her and her family's quality of life by increasing her household income. 

Margarita's short term plans are to expand her business so that she can keep supporting her family.

Choluteca, Honduras – September, 2013

loans.use: to buy bananas, avocados, tomatoes, plantains, watermelon, melon, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Oscar Edgardo

texts.es: Oscar es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, vive junto a su compañera de vida y tres hijos menores de edad. Él solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para repellar las paredes de su casa, así mismo el utilizara el préstamo para terminar de colocar piso de cerámica en su casa, con lo que podrá comprar la cerámica, cemento, arena, pegamento y todo lo necesario para realizar el mejor trabajo y así contar con una casa en mejor estado para él y su familia.
texts.en: Oscar is a hardworking and responsible father who lives with his partner and three young children. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to put plaster on the walls of his home, and also to finish laying ceramic flooring in his home. He will use the money to buy ceramic, cement, sand, adhesive and everything else he needs to carry out the best work he can in order to give his family a better home.

loans.use: To plaster the walls of his home and finish laying ceramic flooring.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga, ha visto que hacer buen uso de los créditos como lo hizo ella con el que se le facilito antes le dio mejores resultados en sus ganancias, tiene más clientes, amplió su negocio, necesita capital para comprar productos de la canasta básica (arroz, frijol, aceite, etc.). 
Para Olga las condiciones familiares le han cambiado en gran medida, hoy les brinda más apoyo a sus hijos, gracias a la rentabilidad de su negocio pudo enfrentar un problema de salud que tuvo su hija, el cual ya fue superado y no le impidió cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Olga has seen that making good use of the loans like she’s done with her previous one leads to good results with respect to profits.  She has more customers and she’s expanded the business.  She needs capital to buy basic staple goods (rice, beans, oil, etc.)

Olga’s family conditions have changed greatly.  She’s able now to offer her children more support.  Thanks to her business’ profitability she was able to face a health problem one of her daughters had which has now been overcome and it also didn’t keep her from making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy basic staple goods.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: El Sr. Franklin tiene la edad de 53 años de edad, tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad,  el se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio,  libros etc. El vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de naciones Unidas, El Sr. Franklin vive en casa familiar, solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de material escolar para su librería – bazar ya que le va muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona responsable y trabajadora, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Franklin, age 53, has two grown children.  He sells stationery, desk supplies, and books, etc.  He sells a variety of products according to the season.  His book store is located in the area of the United Nations.  He lives in the family home.

He is requesting the loan to buy merchandise, school materials, for his bookstore.  It is going very well for him.  Because of the location of the business he has good sales.  He is a responsible and hard-working person.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy school materials.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia, age 37, earns a living by sewing clothes. Two years ago, she started her own business to give her family a better future. She stitches uniforms for  people living in her neighborhood and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily needs of her customers. That is why she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan for Rs. 30,000. She intends to use this loan to buy supplies, including cloth, thread, lace and ribbons in different colors. This will allow her to complete her customer orders on time. She plans to spend the part of income she earns on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth, thread, lace and ribbons in different colors.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Nestor vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar  alimento como por ejemplos concentrados y pastos, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Néstor lives in the city of Pilcopata in Kosñipata District, Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department, Peru.  His main economic activity is raising small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  

On this occasion he needs the loan to buy animal feed like concentrate and forage.  He’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and forage.

loans.name: Sinia Aydee

texts.es:
Sinia, tiene 35 años, está casada tienen dos hijos de 7 y 5 años. Tiene su negocio de venta de medicina natural, desde muy temprano cada día sale a vender sus productos para generar un ingreso y así apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa. Está solicitando un crédito para poder surtir bien su venta, con la inversión comprara pastillas para el estomago, vitaminas, jarabes (con origen natural).
Con esta inversión ella incrementara sus ganancias, fortalecerá su negocio, su prioridad es satisfacer las necesidades que su familia tiene, sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y puedan abrirse paso en un mundo de profesionales.
texts.en:
Sinia, 35, is married with two children aged 7 and 5.  Her business is selling natural remedies.  She heads out very early every day to sell her products to generate income and help her husband with household expenses.  She’s asking for the loan to stock up for her sales.  She will buy stomach pills, vitamins and syrups (of natural origin).

She will increase profits and strengthen her business with this investment.  Her priority is meeting her family’s needs and she dreams with her children becoming professionals so they can forge paths in the professional world.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies.

loans.name: Rozeena

texts.en: Rozeena is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es: María de 64 años de edad, siempre ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus esfuerzos, ella trabaja elaborando tamales y atoles platos típicos de la zona; y vive únicamente junto a su esposo. María solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder mandar a construir un muro en un pasillo de su casa, y así poder resguardar sus pertenecías de la lluvia ya que sin este no hay protección y el agua entra a la casa. Con este préstamo María comprará lo materiales de construcción para poder construir el muro.
texts.en:
María, 64, has always managed to get ahead thanks to her own efforts.  She works making tamales and ‘atole’ [corn-based beverage], traditional local dishes.  She lives just with her husband.

María is asking FUSAI for a loan to have a wall erected in one of the hallways at home to protect her belonging from the rain because without it there’s no protection and water gets into the house.  María will use the loan to buy building supplies to be able to erect the wall.

loans.use: to erect a wall.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta abarrotes como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros cosas más. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Marleny lives in the city of Pilcopata in Kosñipata District, Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department, Peru.  Her main economic activity is selling groceries like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc.  

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.  She’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: Timoteo vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la construcción de casas y obras. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como cementos y madera, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Timoteo lives in the city of Pilcopata in Kosñipata District, Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department, Peru.  His main economic activity is building houses and other construction work.  

On this occasion he needs the loan to buy building supplies like cement and lumber.  He’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Nelly Yobana

texts.es: Nelly vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de frutas y cítricos como por ejemplo naranjas, limones, mandarinas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar piñas y naranjas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Nelly lives in the city of Pilcopata in Kosñipata District, Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department, Peru.  Her main economic activity is selling fruit and citrus fruit like oranges, lemons, mandarins and others.  

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy pineapples and oranges.  She’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy pineapples and oranges.

loans.name: Aiah

texts.en: Meet 32-year-old Aiah from the Jui Eastern area in Freetown. He is married with one child, age 13.  In 2008, Aiah established a spare parts business. He began his business because his family could no longer afford to pay his college fees. So, he raised money to start up his business. Before, he had worked as a cleaner. He works at the business 10 hours per day and seven days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of enough capital. Aiah requires a loan to buy engine oil, headlights and helmets to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and repay his loan. In the future; Aiah plans to build his own business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy engine oil, headlights and helmets to expand his business.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is 51 years old, married and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Zarina’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses. But now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Zarina has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 for her husband to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Zarina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dinora vive junto a su única hija de trece años de edad por quien trabaja muy duro para salir adelante. Su casa es muy humilde y está construida de láminas, las cuales en su mayoría están picadas, enmohecidas y viejas por lo que es muy necesario cambiarlas en su mayoría; es por esta razón que Dinora solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para, es un proyecto muy importante para ambas ya que les dará mayor tranquilidad en su hogar.
texts.en: Dinora lives with her only daughter who is 13-years-old.  She works hard for her to get ahead.  Her house is very humble and built of sheets of metal most of which are rotten, moldy and old which is why most of them need to be replaced.  This is why Dinora is asking FUSAI for a loan in order to have the money needed for this project with is very important to both of them for it will provide more comfort at home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Alexander Anival

texts.es: Alexander vive junto a sus padres a quienes les brinda ayuda para sostener el hogar, él es un joven con muchos deseos de salir adelante y poder también mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. Alexander solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, con el cual cuente con el dinero necesario para realizar un muro perimetral, ya que actualmente no cuenta con uno, es por esta razón que con el dinero obtenido gracias al préstamo otorgado podrá comprar los materiales necesario como: ladrillos, hierro, cemento y arena para construir el muro y de este modo vivir más seguro y tranquilo junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Alexander lives with his parents who he helps to support the home.  He’s a young man with a strong drive to get ahead and to be able to improve the conditions of his home.  

Alexander is asking FUSAI for a loan to have money needed to build a wall along the perimeter of his house since he currently lacks one.  With the money from the granted loan he’ll be able to buy the necessary supplies like bricks, iron rods, cement and sand to erect the wall to live with his family more securely and with peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, venta que está ubicada en el patio de su casa, para resguardarse del sol y la lluvia ella ha construido una pequeña champa hecha de láminas y madera, materiales que están totalmente deteriorados, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para invertir en la compra de láminas nuevas y vigas de madera para reconstruirla y así contar con un mejor lugar de trabajo.
texts.en: Ana lives with her husband and two minor children.  She’s a very hardworking woman who works making tortillas to sell in the patio of her house.  To protect them from the sun and rain she’s built a small shed out of metal sheets and wood, materials that are totally deteriorated which is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy new metal sheets and wood beams to rebuild it and have a better workplace.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a resident living in a small village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She is a 65-year-old married woman who earns a living by cultivating rice on her own farmland. She has been in this business since she was young. She is a mother of five children, who she loves the most, and who encourage her to keep going on with this farming business even though it’s a hard work for a woman of her age. She is happy and, thanks to her efforts, she can help her five children in their marriages. 

The reason for this loan is for Ly to buy fishing materials and to fix her boat in order to restart fishing activities again during this season and until December or January. Her son is closely involved in this business to financially support the family and experience a quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and to fix her boat in order to restart fishing activities.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is 55 years old, married and living in the village of Kardenakhi with her husband and grown son. The only one earning money in the household is Nadia’s spouse, who works in construction locally. But he works on special projects, so his earnings are unstable. The family has a small vineyard and seasonally sells grapes. As the living conditions of the family are very poor, Nadia decided to apply for the credit and start a business trading clothes among her community members. There are not many clothing stores in her district and people can’t afford to buy apparel due to high prices. With the received credit, she will transport apparel and household items from the capital city open market and resell them at reasonable prices. She will also give her customers opportunities to buy items and pay later. This initiative will attract many customers and Nadia will generate income. She will continue the business and invest her funds in trading again to increase sales volume. Nadia appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and household items for resale

loans.name: Susana Del Carmen

texts.es: Susana es una mujer muy devota a su hogar y su familia por lo que trabaja muy duro para contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida estable junto a su esposo y tres hijos. Debido a que en el lugar que Susana reside no cuentan con agua potable muy regularmente, ella solicita un préstamo para poder construir una pila grande para almacenar más agua y así contar siempre con este vital liquido, así mismo mandará a encementar todo su patio ya que actualmente es de tierra lo que es muy incómodo ya que produce mucho polvo en su hogar.
texts.en:
Susana is a woman who is very devoted to her home and family, so she works very hard to have everything necessary for a stable life with her husband and three children. 

Due to the fact that where Susana lives, they don't have potable water on a very regular basis, she is requesting a loan so that she can build a large basin to store more water and this way always have this vital liquid.  As well, she will have her entire patio cemented, as currently it is of earth, which is very inconvenient as it produces a great deal of dust in her home.

loans.use: To construct a basin for storing water.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, él trabaja como conductor de autobuses y es así como lleva el sustento diario a su hogar. Julio desea poder construir un muro perimetral en su casa, ya que actualmente no cuenta con uno, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para realizar la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y de esta forma mandar a ser este muro el cual hasta ahora le había sido imposible realizar.
texts.en: Julio lives with his wife and two minor children. He works as a bus driver and that is how he provides for his family. Julio wants to build a wall along the permiter of his house, since he currently doesn't have one. That is the reason why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI, so that he can have the money he needs to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron. This will allow him to have this wall built, which he had been unable to do until now.

loans.use: to buy bricks to build a wall around his home.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina is a 46-year-old married mother of two school-aged children. They live in the northern part of the country in a little town with an approximate population of 10,000. She just started running her own activity of selling/renting bridal dresses and other accessories for weddings. This will be the first store of such a kind in their town, thus she is positive it will go well. 

Rozina wants to stock up on items she needs for the store and she says your help will be greatly appreciated. The loan she is looking for is the amount of 150,000 Albanian lek (ALL).

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items of bridal dresses and wedding accessories to rent/sell

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is 23 years old. She enjoys doing work of hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and she makes a good amount of income to contribute to her family's income. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

In order to meet the growing demand for her embroidery, Amna needs to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors.  With these, she would be able to complete the orders of her customers on time. 

Amna has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Space

texts.en:
Space is a villager who lives in the southeastern part of the country. He wants to build a stable for his animals before bitter winter kicks in soon. The stable that you see in the background of the picture is the current one, and it is not appropriate for the animals, according to him. 

“It snows so much in our village and our region is known for the longest and coldest winters that go up to seven months covered in snow. So, my animals cannot stay in such cold. Also, because of the bitter winters, hungry wolves come down searching for food themselves and in many occasions they have grabbed our neighbors’ goats. I don’t want this to happen to mine,” said Space.

Space is a father of ten children who for the past almost twenty years have been operating his livestock activity. He is happy he has this because it has been the only source of income for his large family.

loans.use: to build a proper stable for the animals before winter kicks in

loans.name: Fakhar

texts.en: Fakhar is a 48-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for PKR 25,000, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es: María trabaja muy duro cosiendo zapatos, trabajo al cual se dedica desde hace muchos años. Ella vive sola en su casa de habitación desde hace doce años y es muy conocida por ser muy educada y responsable. María solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder construir una nueva fosa séptica en su casa y así mismo para mandar a encementar un pasillo de su casa el cual está hecho de tierra, lo que hace que mucho polvo entre en su casa, situación que María podrá cambiar gracias a este préstamo.
texts.en:
María works very hard sewing shoes, work she has been doing for many years. She has been living alone in her home for 12 years, and is well known for being very polite and responsible. 

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can build a new cesspit for her home and to have a hallway cemented. Currently it is of earth, which means that a great deal of dust comes into her home; a situation that Maria will be able to change thanks to this loan.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building a cesspit.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Yovana lives in the city of Pilcopata, in Kosñipata district, Paucartambo province, department of Cusco, Peru. Her main business is farming and raising livestock and smaller animals like Guinea pigs and chickens. 

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy Guinea pigs. She is grateful and appreciates the loan and promises to be very responsible about paying her monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 43-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with  packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will help her to stitch up more dresses on time. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good credit history. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Xhevaire

texts.en:
Xhevaire is an Egyptian lady who lives in the midst of her community in a main city in southern Albania where the majority of the Egyptian community lives. Some of them raise pigs and others have their own little trade services activities. Although some of them are doing extremely well financially, some are literally struggling to make a living or live healthily. 

Xhevaire wants to make some repairs to her one-room house (shown in the picture). She is married and has three children who are grownups, and this will be her first loan. “While this might be my first loan, I promise that I will make the payments accordingly,” she said.

loans.use: to make minor repairs to her one-room family house

loans.name: Glades

texts.en:
Glades is a 46-year-old divorced mother of two children, who four years ago opened her own sweets and cakes bakery to provide her children with a good living. She is a hard worker who is making so much effort to make sure that she can cover her children's education needs since she is their sole breadwinner. Glades is well-known among competitors in her region for her special quality goods produced and the customer service she provides, which keeps her away far away from them.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a special automatic dough-spreading machine, which is necessary for her business development. She states that her current business passed through many challenges and obstacles, which she handled in a well-managed way. She hopes to keep on developing her business and providing her customers and children with their requested needs and more. She is planning to see her products distributed all over Lebanon as a start.

loans.use: To buy a special automatic dough-spreading machine necessary for her business

loans.name: Inocente Rita

texts.es: La señora Inocente Rita, tiene la edad de 51 años es soltera, habita junto a su hijo en su hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de catálogos por encargo y un poco de ropa y calzados en su casa de habitación, así también sale a las calles a vender, por medio de este negocio Inocente Rita obtiene sus ingresos diarios para sus gastos. Solicita este crédito con el objetivo de invertir en su pequeño negocio, comprando variedades de camisas, pantalones, sandalias y perfumes. De esta manera espera obtener mejores ingresos para ir creciendo en productos y poco a poco mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Inocente Rita is 51 years old and is single.  She lives together with her son in their home.  She sells products from catalogs on commission and some clothes and footwear out of her home, as well as selling them on the street.  Because of this business, Inocente Rita earns a daily income for her expenses.  

She is requesting this loan in order to invest in her small business, buying a variety of shirts, pants, sandals and perfumes.  Through this she hopes to earn a better income to continue increasing in products and improving her financial situation bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy a range of shirts, pants, sandals, and perfumes

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a 34-year-old married woman doing business selling goats. She has been doing this business for the last two years. 

Ayesha purchases small goats, and after raising them, sells them to the people of her community and in the local market. At present, she has two goats. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses. 

Ayesha is happily running her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. This is her 2nd year with the Kashf Foundation. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy one more goat. She hopes to increase her income and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more goat.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Farming business is preferable for most of people living in the countryside of Cambodia and it can be considered as the traditional business since a thousand years ago. Among the farming people of the area is Mom, a 40-year-old woman and a mother of three single children, who cultivates the land for growing rice in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. Having been in this business for years, she is able to make a net profit of $4 per day to cover her daily living costs.

Now she has applied for a loan in the sum of $800, which will be used to place her son in a vocational training center in Phnom Penh, where he can learn to be a car mechanic. Through this loan support, she can provide an opportunity for her son and she hopes that this can help him to be successful in his career in the future.

loans.use: to pay for vocational school fees of her son.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es: Silvia de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, Ella posee una venta de ropa tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; Silvia es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando,  luchando por salir adelante. Para Silvia el propósito y coraje que le pone a su labor tiene una dirección ver crecer el negocio para lograr un mejor futuro, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
Twenty-nine year old Silvia lives in her own house with her life partner and her son.  She has a clothing sales shop, and has different styles for everyone -- ladies, gentlemen, boys and girls.  The clothes she sells are of very good quality, and she sells them at reasonable prices, which is why she has had a lot of customers lately.

Silvia is very active.  She is always working, striving to get ahead.  For Silvia, the purpose and courage she puts into her work have a singular focus:  to see her business grow in order to secure a better future.  This is why she decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy a variety of clothing, such as skirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, suits, etc.  This way she will always be able to satisfy her customers' needs.

She hopes that in this way, she will be able to give her family financial security and a full life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, such as skirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, suits, etc.

loans.name: Varsenik

texts.en:
Varsenik is a young farmer from the Agarak city of the Syuniq region. She lives with her parents and her two sisters. Varsenik's parents work in the copper-molybdenum factory. However, their salaries alone are not enough to cover the needs of the family. To be able to earn a living, Varsenik is engaged in breeding cattle and in horticulture; she cultivates peach, apricot, cherry, quince, pomegranate, fig, blood orange, pear and walnut. There is a  high demand for those fruits in the market. As it has become harder to cover daily expenses, Varsenik currently wants to enlarge the herd of cattle to be able to meet the everyday needs of the family more effectively. She needs a loan of $3000 to purchase three cows. 

As this is Varsenik’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Varsenik and her family will be very grateful to the lenders for their good will in helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Meet Hannah, she is a 48-year-old woman from Jui in the eastern area of Freetown. She is widowed with two children. In 2008, Hannah established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business. 

Hannah requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Hannah plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Monicar

texts.en: Monicar is 38 years old. She is a married female and supports four children aged 15, 12,7 and 2. Monicar was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET staff member and she is a taking her first loan of 10, 000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She runs a café  business which has five years now located at Kibaoni and earns monthly income of 4,000 KES.She will use the loan to add stock in her business, wheat flour, maize flour, oil,sugar,salt and utensils. Also, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her cafe. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to expand her business by making it into a restaurant and she plans to educate her children and make sure they live well.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, oil, sugar, and salt to make food to sell  to  her customers.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 33 años es una mujer trabajadora. Ella habita en la casa que heredó de su madre, ahí formó su familia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos a los que ama y son su razón de vivir. Está hábil y emprendedora mujer se dedica a la artesanía, la actividad agrícola de la mayoría de habitantes de la zona. Desde muy joven comenzó tejiendo diversas prendas de vestir de deferentes colores y tamaño. Con el tiempo pudo adquirir telares para tejer mayor variedad de prendas artesanales. Pero cuando formó su familia junto a su esposo, logró adquirir con su apoyo, un terreno agrícola extenso en la ciudad de Junín, donde comenzaron a sembrar maca en grandes cantidades. Según cuenta su esposo viaja constante a ese lugar, para poder cuidar de sus cultivos, además de aprovechar en dedicarse a su oficio de albañilería, con lo que hasta el momento puede ahorrar dinero para sus futuros planes. Ya que desean para el futuro abrir una tienda grande y surtida, donde pueda Silvia, vender sus tejidos y confecciones a un buen precio y ya no estar repartiendo a terceras personas. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues mejorará su ingreso económico, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Silvia, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de materiales como: palos de madera, algodón y diferentes tipos de hilos para confeccionar sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Silvia, 33 years old, is a hardworking woman.  She lives in the house that she inherited from her mother.  There, she started her family with her husband and two children, whom she loves and who are her reason for living.  This able and enterprising woman makes her living in handicrafts and in the same farming activity as most of the area's inhabitants.

From a young age, she began knitting various outfits in different colors and sizes. With time, she was able to acquire looms to be able to weave a greater variety of traditional garments.  

When she started her family with her husband, she was able to acquire, with his help, extensive farmland in the city of Junín, where they began to plant maca [a local root vegetable] in large quantities.  According to her, her husband travels constantly to this place to care for their crops, in addition to making his living as a carpenter, through which he has been able to save money for their future plans.  In the future, they would like to open a large and well-stocked store, where Silvia can sell her weaves and products at a good price instead of distributing to third parties.

This is her fourth loan with KIVA.  She is grateful for the financial support she has received, because it will improve her income.  In exchange, she promises to be punctual with her payments.

Silvia will invest the 500 soles in the purchase of materials such as:  wood needles, cotton, and different types of threads to make her weaves.

loans.use: to buy wood needles, cotton and different types of threads.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Meet Elizabeth. She is 30 years old and from Jui, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with two children. For the past 10 years, Elizabeth established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Elizabeth requires a loan in order to purchase more clothes and local foodstuffs to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Elizabeth plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and local foodstuffs to expand her business.

loans.name: Esperanza Viva (Hope Is Alive) Group

texts.en:
The nine women of the group Esperanza Viva (Hope is Alive) live in the small Cocales neighborhood of Nahualate, in the municipality of San Antonio, Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.  They gave this name to their group because they hope that with their hard work and the support of Namaste money management classes and the Namaste Business Advisor they will meet their business objectives, increase their incomes, and improve their lives.  These women are all very poor, have very little education and live in very simple houses, some with dirt floors.  They have a variety of businesses such as local clothing sales, corn and corn meal sales, chicken meat sales, meal preparation and a very small store.

Doña Tiburcia (1st from left) is a 58-year-old widow with a third-grade education, and 11 children, all grown up.  Her husband was killed 11 years ago in a robbery.  At that time she did not work, but she had to earn money.  She started working in a nursery, saving a little money so that she could someday start her own business.  After a few years she was able to start selling snacks and then started a small store in front of a public school.  Her goal is to increase her inventory of the items that the mothers and children at the school want to buy.

Tiburcia has been invited by the local public school to talk on Mother’s Day to tell her story.  On these occasions, she talks about her life to show other women that when you have a dream and you work hard, there is nothing that can stop you.  Her children (two of whom live with her and help her) are very proud of her.
 Her current profit is about US $245 working 125 hours per month.  Her objective during this nine-month Namaste cycle is to improve her profit by 27% to about US $312.

loans.use: to buy in bulk the items families want to buy when they pick up their children at school

loans.name: Reinel

texts.es: Reinel es un hombre dedicado a atender su negocio, un almacén de variedades que inició hace 13 años, trabaja solo todos los días de 9:00 am a 8:00 pm, esta actividad la aprendió cuando le colaboraba a un familiar que tenía un establecimiento similar, allí aprendió todo sobre el manejo de este tipo de negocio; el local está muy bien ubicado en una zona de alto tráfico de personas, y su almacén está muy acreditado y bien surtido. El cliente se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy organizado, trabajador y activo, tiene un espíritu de superación que lo impulsa para lograr los objetivos que se propone. El crédito que solicita es para  para aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene disminuyendo el costo de la mercancía, lo que permite tener un margen de ganancia más alto en cada venta, además tendrá más variedad de productos disponibles para ofrecer en la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, donde sus ventas aumentan notablemente, beneficiando sus finanzas familiares. Reinel es un soñador y, en un futuro cercano desea abrir un nuevo almacén para complementar sus ingresos, generando una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reinel is a man dedicated to his business, a retail store which he opened thirteen years ago. He works on his own every day from 9:00 am to 8:00 pm. He learned the trade by helping a relative who had a similar business. There he learned everything about managing this type of business. The store is in a very good location, an area where there is a lot of customer traffic flow, and it has a very good reputation and is very well stocked. 

This client is known for being a very well organized man, hardworking and active. His spirit and drive for self improvement motivate him to achieve his goals. He will use the loan he is requesting to make the most of the discounts he receives and reduce the cost of merchandise. This will allow him to make a higher profit margin from every sale. He will also have a wider variety of products available to offer during the coming Christmas season. His sales increase considerably during this time and his family finances benefit from it. 

Reinel is a dreamer, and in the near future he wants to open a new retail store to supplement his income and generate the financial stability that would give his family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (blouses, jeans, shoes, cosmetics, accessories).

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 48 years old and has six children. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production. He needs fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, Innocent wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing, as well as seed and fertilizer from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old, married, and has four children, who attend school. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, Emmanuel wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing, as well as seed and fertilizer from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is from the Dzoraget village of the Lori region. He lives with his wife and grandfather. He is a clerk in the government sector. Armen is the only breadwinner of the family. However, his salary is so low that he cannot afford a living with that salary alone. He has been engaged in beekeeping for several years and is very experienced. Armen's wife helps him in the everyday activities related to beekeeping. Armen sells the honey not only in the local market, but also outside of the village. 

To be able to continue the beekeeping in a sustainable way, he needs to make some investments. Armen needs a loan of $1,000 to purchase more beehives. It will help him sustain and develop his agribusiness. Armen and his family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them collect the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase more beehives

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Fatmata from Jui in the eastern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 15 and 25 years. For over 16 years, Fatmata established her food commodities business. She began her business because she wants to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that at present she is facing with high competition in the market.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits, and pure water for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Fatmata plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits, and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Alma Marina

texts.es: Alba  es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus  dos hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 8 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Alba solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Alba is a single mother.  She lives in her own home with her two children, 13 and 9 years old.  She has had a beauty salon for 8 years in her home.  She works from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm and has a large clientele, as she works very well.  With her earnings from this she manages to settle her household expenses.

Alba is requesting a loan to be able to buy products for her beauty salon such as: creams, shampoos, hairpins, scissors, among other things which she needs, and so she will be able to make a better income which will help her have an improved economic stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoos, hairpins, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, causing the goods to perish and leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding the business into a modern cafe.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is an experienced farmer from Spitak city in the Lori region. He lives with his wife and four sons; the oldest son is in the army now, and the other three of them are school-aged boys. Gagik is involved in breeding cows, sheep, pigs and hens, in beekeeping, and in cultivation of wheat, barley, potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, and eggplants. Farming is the only source of income for the family. As their needs are growing day by day, Gagik needs to expand his agribusiness to be able to cover the needs of his family. He needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase two cows and to buy some forage for the livestock. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution in the past, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. 

However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Gagik was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Gagik and his big family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and to buy some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Isatu   A C

texts.en:
Isatu is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She is from Jui, Sierra Leone. For the past five years, Isatu has operated her pharmacy business. She works at the business 12 house a day, seven days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the distances she travels to see her customers. 

Isatu is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more pain tablets, cholera medicine, and malarial drugs to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Isatu plans to open a big pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase pain tablets, cholera medicine, and malarial drugs

loans.name: Abdel Qader

texts.en:
Abdel Qader, a 26-year-old single man from the city of Jabalia, lives with his parents and brothers in a humble house. His father, the family's sole income-earner, works seasonally in an aluminum factory, while Abdel is studying Islamic Education at the university. He wants to complete his studies and find a job in a local school to help his family.


Abdel has received a predispersed USD loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will enable him to more effectively complete his homework and reports. 


Abdel appears in the photo with his laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 43 years old. He is married with three children. He has been a farmer for the past 12 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing, as well as seed and fertilizer from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Erica is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She cites food and fees as her greatest monthly expense.

She sells lesos (women's wrap cloths).  Her business has been operational for one year. Her potential clients are neighbors and town dwellers. She cites seasonality as a challenge in her business.

With the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan, she wants to purchase 60 lesos (women's wrap cloths) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase 60 lesos (women's wrap cloths) for resale.

loans.name: Zhana

texts.en:
Zhana is 22 years old, divorced, and lives alone in the Chiatura district. Zhana is jobless at the moment and, in fact, without a source of income. She requested a small-sized loan to start up a beauty salon, as she used to work as a hairstylist and has experience in this field.

Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of a business start-up and re-start-up credits with reasonable conditions for the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. Zhana wants to hire the space and purchase all the needed modern inventory for a haircare business. She will serve the customers as a stylist herself and generate daily income. According to her estimates, the business will be lucrative and the increased profit will be reinvested in the same business. Zhana will be able to increase her spending to satisfy her daily needs and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to start a beauty salon

loans.name: Argam

texts.en:
Argam is a young farmer from the village of Aramus, in the Kotayq region. He is widowed and lives alone. Argam works in the private sector. To be able to take care of himself, he also breeds a livestock of cows, pigs, and piglets. Argam sells the agricultural products in the local market. Farming is an important source of income for him. 

As life is getting more expensive, day by day, Argam needs to enlarge his livestock to meet his needs. He currently needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase a cow and some forage for the livestock. 

Argam highly relies on the goodwill of the lenders and he will be very grateful to them for helping him maintain and improve his agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Trabajando Por El Futuro Group

texts.es: El grupo “TRABAJANDO POR EL FUTURO”  se encuentra conformada por 11 socias trabajadores y responsables con sus cuotas de grupo. Isabel tiene 38 años es conviviente  con 02 hijos educando. Hace 15 años es concesionaria  de fuegos recreativos en un club campestre. Años atrás se dedicaba a la agricultura con el apoyo de su esposo. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una cama elástica. Su  mayor deseo es iniciar la construcción de mini departamentos para darlos en alquiler. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Isabel es la primera persona sentada del lado izquierdo viste polo amarillo. Y de la misma manera se encuentra incluida la foto de Guísela en la parte superior derecho que no pudo estar en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
The "Trabajando por el Futuro" group is made up of 11 members who are hard-working, and responsible with their group payments. Isabel is 38, lives with her partner, and has two children who go to school. For 15 years she has been an amusement games concessionaire at a country club. Years ago she farmed with the support of her husband. 

She will use the loan to purchase a trampoline. Her greatest wish is to start building rooms to rent out. 

The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan offered. Isabel is the first person seated on the left, wearing a yellow T-shirt. Likewise, in the upper right part is the photo of Guísela, who could not be at the meeting due to work reasons.

loans.use: To buy a trampoline.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn, aged 31, is a rice farmer living in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She is married and her husband helps her with farming activities and is a carpenter specializing in making beds, which he sells at the market of the province and in other parts of the country. Through their hard work on their family-owned businesses, they are able to make an average of USD 17.60 per day to support their household.

Vorn wishes to expand her business by purchasing wood for making beds. Then she can sell to the wholesalers and make a better profit. Due to inadequate capital, she has requested a loan in the amount of 1,200 US dollars from Kiva lenders. Last but not least, she says she is really grateful to all Kiva lenders who offer the loan to bring to her life a great change by their funds.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing wood for making beds.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 47-year-old married woman with five children. She ventured into retail trade in 1997 after consistent unpredictable rainy seasons in the area hence she could not raise enough food and income from her farm to take care of her family. She started a retail store trading in bicycles and bicycle spare parts. This idea was triggered by the poor means of transport used by the residents of her village at that time. 

Margret has since diversified into motorcycle spare parts due to an increase in the number of motorcycles in the region, and she has plans to sell motorcycles in the near future. Margret was introduced to the solar lanterns which provide bright and safe lighting and come with a mobile charging function by BrazAfric green energy marketing team. Because of the recurring cost and health effects associated with paraffin which is the commonly used lighting fuel in her community, she saw an opportunity to boost her sales, increase productivity and raise the living conditions of people in the community. 

Margret appreciates the benefits accruing from the use of solar lanterns, and with the Kiva financing option from Brazafric, she is seeking financing to purchase solar lanterns to stock and sell to her community. Margret points out that she would buy some solar lanterns to use in her farm and also for her shop to increase her working hours.

loans.use: to buy solar lanterns

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old and married, with three children between the ages of four and eleven years. She runs a domestic product business in Jui, an eastern area in Freetown.

Sarah's been in this business since 2007 and she sells glass cups, knives, and food containers within her community. She says that the main problem with her business is that, sometimes, there is low purchasing power.

Sarah requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. 

In the future, Sarah would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to resell.

loans.name: Jean Nepomuscene

texts.en:
Jean Nepomuscene is 47 years old. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor costs during maize production. He  needs fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing, as well as seed and fertilizer from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Maferah

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Maferah from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  In 2006, Maferah established her retail business. She began her business because she did not go school and she was trained in business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She is very hard-working and desires to improve her standard of living

Maferah requires a loan in order to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and expand her business. In the future, Maferah plans to expand her business still more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Messie

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Massie from Jui, in the eastern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of 8 and 12 years. For over 10 years, Massie established her food commodities business. She began her business because she wants to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that at present she is facing high competition in the market.

Massie requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits, and pure water to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Massie plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits, and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 48 years old. She is married with six children. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. Farmers need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Muasya

texts.en:
Muasya is a businesswoman who is very hard-working. She is a mother of three school-going children. She lives in her rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Muasya has operates a pool table business where her clients come to play table pool games. She has been in this business for the last three years. She cites maintenance costs as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase another pool table for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase another pool table for her business

loans.name: Sadah

texts.en:
Sadah is divorced. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her largest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her two children.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereal shop in which she sells household consumables like wheat, rice, maize, and grains. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges in the business. 

She requests 30,000 KES to boost her cereal business by enabling her to purchase wheat, maize, rice, and grains to sell. She dreams of expanding into the wholesale market in the near future.

loans.use: to buy wheat, maize, rice, and grains to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, de 47 años, vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rolando y su hijo menor de 22 años, a quienes quiere  mucho. El negocio al que se dedica Nora son los tejidos artesanales, tiene su puesto de venta en el centro artesanal del poblado de San Pedro de Cajas, en el cual vende las prendas que ella misma confecciona y que son rápidamente compradas por sus clientes, ya que los modelos que hace son muy novedosos. Además de surtir los mismos con variedades de telares y tapices de otros artesanos de la zona.
