This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer for the corn cultivation that is already established and that she works on together with her siblings.

What Verónica wants most is to be a mother, and give her child the schooling and the luxuries that she was not able to have.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for corn cultivation

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 26-year-old married woman.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Abida is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Al-Yousfy Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Yousfy, and consists of four female members who live in Sana'a, Yemen. 

Huda is a 36-year-old married woman; she has seven children and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She sold her jewels to build her house. 

She lives with her children in a bad situation; her husband's income isn't enough to cover what his family needs. She would like remodel her house, so she needs a loan to buy building materials such as cement and lumber. 

She is grateful for the loan, and commits to making her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and lumber to remodel her house.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 65 years old and supporting a family of two people.

Stephen owns rental houses.  He has been in this business for the past 16 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000.  

Stephen has qualified to get his fifth loan from KADET LTD of KES 50,000, with which he plans to renovate his rental houses and also buy a water tank. With the anticipated profit, Stephen will build more rental houses.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business to support his family.

loans.use: To renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Maarif

texts.en:
Maarif is 47, married, and he has five kids, two sons and three daughters. He earns a living by breeding cows and cattle, and sells their milk and milk products as well as meat to local butchers. He has 20 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him how to look after cattle. 

Maarif  usually buys small cows, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and resells them for a profitable price to butchers. Milk and yogurt he sells to neighbors. He earns about 180 AZN a month, in part because milk, yogurt, and meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yogurt. Milk products are seen as very healthy and used daily. 

Because his family has only one source of income, Maarif is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy three cattle and two milk cows. 

This will be his second loan. He has a good client history, and plans to use the additional income he earns to care for his family.

loans.use: to buy three cattle and two milk cows.

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.ru: Джамолиддин жизнерадостный человек. Ему 32 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Джамолиддин уже более 11 лет занимается скотоводством. Он покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Он замечательно справляется с бизнесом. Его жена Мачигул помогает ему по введению бизнеса. Джамолиддин очень заботливый отец. Он всегда старается, чтобы его дети росли в достатке. Джамолиддин хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Это его второй займ. Первый займ он использовал для развития своего бизнеса и погасил своевременно. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2200 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Jamoliddin is a 32-year-old with a cheerful disposition, a wife, and 2 kids.  He is a caring father to his children, and always tries his best to ensure they have everything they need.  By trade, he is a livestock farmer; for the past 11 years, he has been buying livestock, then selling them at a local market after fattening them for a few months.  He is very good at what he does.  His wife Machigul also helps him with his business.      

Jamoliddin wishes to increase the working capital of his business, which would increase his income in turn.  This would be his second loan; he used the first one to grow his business, and paid it off in a timely manner.  He is requesting a loan of $2200 (USD) to buy more livestock, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy livestock to increase his working capital

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros in very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her.  She was able to buy spare parts for her tricycle and have it repaired and maintained as well.  Her income from business is helpful in her everyday expenses at home.  She also sells some snacks for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.  Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagros hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams to have a good life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  At that time, she also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Syeeda's Group

texts.en:
Syeeda is 40 years old and has four children whose ages are 15, 13, 11 and 9 years old. All of them have completed only up to their fifth year of middle school because Syeeda hasn't had many economic resources and hasn't been able to pay for their studies as they would have liked.  Syeeda himself has only studied up to the fifth year of middle school. 
Her husband is a rickshaw driver, and he transports passengers through the streets of his city. He puts forth a lot of effort into his job and he works about 12 hours every day and attends to about 80 customers. He tells us that every day is a good day because he is able to return home with money for household costs, which gives Syeeda a little peace at the end of the day.  He believes that his business is going well because he has a lot of faith in God and believes that God guides him.  For this reason, he always has something to take home because he is honest, honorable and respects his customers.

Syeeda is actually very grateful for Kiva loan.  This would be the first time that they have given her their support and with it she will be able to make improvements for her family. Her husband will buy new tires and change the seats on his rickshaw, and with these improvements, he will be able to improve his customers' comfort and thus obtain higher earnings. He hopes to be able to save enough to accomplish his dream: “To buy a furnished house”.

loans.use: to buy new tires and seats for her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Be Zaban

texts.en:
Be Zaban is a 53-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of nine children; two of them are young and fully dependent upon their mother.

Her elder son conducts a clothing business. His practice is to buy fabrics from wholesalers and sell them to retailers. He has a lot of customers who like to buy fabrics from him.  Sometimes he purchases fabrics from out of city at low cost and sells them to the retailers. He has a good reputation among the retailers, and his current customers refer his fabrics to others.

Due to his new customers, the demand is increasing day by day but he does not have enough money to buy more fabrics. Therefore, Be Zaban has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son will be able to buy more fabrics to fulfill the increasing demand.

She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.  She has already taken loans from BRAC and invested them in the business. Be Zaban hopes that her savings will much increase, and she can look after her children in a better way. 

Be Zaban dreams of a bright future for her children, of the establishment of the business and of a better living standard of her family.

She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fabrics from wholesalers and resell to retailers.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijas, de 9 años d edad, 11 años de edad y 13 años de edad, todas estudian. Él por su parte solo estudio hasta bachillerato, su esposa es comerciante, vende pupusas todas las tardes. Con Carlos conviven 4 personas mas.

Desde pequeño Carlos se dedico a trabajar la tierra, por la mañana trabajaba con su padre y por las tardes estudiaba. Hoy en día también trabaja la tierra, camina 2 kilómetros para llegar a la parcela; también cuida ganado de repasto y todas las mañanas ordeña 2 vacas, después se va a trabajar al campo y en la tarde regresa con los animales.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar dos vacas de ordeño, esperando poder vender leche para luego comprar su propio ganado de engorde. Espera algún día ver crecidas a sus hijas y con un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 34 years old, is married and has three daughters, ages 9, 11, and 13. All are in school. On his part, he only went to school through high school. His wife is a vendor. She sells pupusas every afternoon. Four more people live with Carlos.

Since he was young, Carlos has worked the land. In the mornings he worked with his father, and in the afternoons he went to school. He also works the land now. He walks two kilometers to arrive at his parcel of land. He also cares for grazing animals, and every morning he milks two cows. Afterwards he goes to work in the field, and in the afternoon he returns with the animals.

The loan will be used to buy two milk cows. He hopes to be able to sell milk and then buy his own cattle to fatten. He hopes one day to see his daughters grown and with university degrees.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 37 years old and is single. He is a small-scale blacksmith who makes school boxes for sale.  He has been in this business for four years and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use the loan to buy more materials for making boxes. These materials include iron sheets and paint. He plans to use the anticipated profits to open a different business as well as take care of his family's needs. This is his second loan term and he paid his previous loan successfully. 

He hopes to own a chain of businesses and ensure that his family becomes financially independent.

loans.use: to buy materials for making boxes.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a single woman with no children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Salome operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of Kshs 15,000 to purchase charcoal to sell. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is 63 years old and married without children.  He lives with his wife in his own city.  He has always worked in agriculture.  For 12 years, he has had his own crops in the zone where he plants and produces potatoes, corn, and beans to sell and to eat.  He sells his potato harvest in the local market.  Yusif’s wife helps him in this business.  

The 1,900 AZN loan will be used to buy supplies for the potato crop (i.e. fertilizers and fungicides) and to prepare land to plant basic grains.  His plan is to invest, to give good care to his crops, and to get better production and earn profits.  He has a good loan history and this is going to be his 2nd loan.  Yusif awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides for the potato crop.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in the Likoni area south of Mombasa, Kenya.  She is 30 years old and married with four children.  She started a small business in her neighborhood three years ago making and selling food.  This is the only activity that she does for a living and the business has been doing great.  

She knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy more wheat flour and cooking oil for the business.  The challenge in the business is finding customers.  She hopes that her business will grow into a restaurant in the future and will be able to serve more people.  She will use her income to improve her living standards and to take her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 38-year-old lady from Homabay which is located in the western part of Kenya.  She supports six people in her family and is married to Mr. Charles who is also providing support to the family.  They have 5 children who are 18, 16, 14, 12 and 10 years old respectively.

She has a tailoring center, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years, and she earns a monthly income of 11,000 Kenyan shillings.  She has requested her second loan with KADET LTD which she will use to boost her business and expand the business.

Her dream is change the living standard of her family and also expand her business.

loans.use: to improve her tailoring center and boost her business.

loans.name: Kimwana

texts.en:
Kimwana is a married woman with two children, one in school and the other is still underage. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing shop business, selling clothes for both men and women. She is a tailor who makes clothes and sells them. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Kimwana is requesting Kshs 25,000 to purchase fabric and thread for her business. 

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Norma Marlene

texts.es:
Norma es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Piura, en el distrito de Jayanca con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Norma ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que desea.
Por iniciativa propia, Norma trabaja como animadora de eventos infantiles,ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Norma se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará los materiales que necesita, como vestimenta, globos, juguetes y otros, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su empresa de animación de eventos sociales.
texts.en:
Norma is a young woman of 19. She is single and lives in the city of Piura, in the Jayanca district, with her parents and siblings. She is very hard-working and enthusiastic and has a great desire to achieve. Unfortunately, because of the lack of economic resources and the need to work, Norma was not able to study the professional course in business administration that she wanted.

On her own initiative, Norma works as an entertainer at children's events. She works every day for about 8 hours and believes that it is going well for her because of her dedication and effort.

Norma is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered she will buy the materials that she needs, such as clothing, balloons, toys, and other items. Thus she will be able to continue working  and striving to achieve her great dream: to have her own entertainment company for social events.

loans.use: to buy entertainment materials

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of six.  She runs a small general shop in her community for last year and a half.  She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list.  In the beginning of her business, she faced many problems because of the lack of business knowledge and experience.  Now, she has learned the business skills and has expanded her business.  

Nasreen has requested for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more items for her general store, such as biscuits, nimko, chips, seasonal vegetables, rice, and sugar.  With the help of this loan, she would be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers and generate more revenue.  She wishes to utilize revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, nimko, chips, seasonal vegetables, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a 37-year-old woman.  She lives with her pensioner mother and 15-year-old daughter in a small village of Mtskheta district.  Her daughter goes to the local school.  Nona has hens and sells eggs.  The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live in poverty.  As a result, Nona lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.  

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 1,200 GEL so that she could start a business, buying and selling clothing.  The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Qardasali

texts.en: Qardasali is 54 years old. He is married with five children. He has practiced agriculture for ten years. His main source of income is selling vegetables, milk, poultry and eggs, and running a small business. He wants to improve his milk production, and has thus requested a loan of 2,000 azn to purchase a dairy cow. Qardasali has a good loan history; this is going to be his fifth loan. He hopes that Kiva will help him. He is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is the age of 37, living with her seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mechanic by profession; he provides services for troubleshooting motorbikes and rickshaws. He always keeps busy repairing vehicles and does not have enough time for his family. He has been recruiting two young workers; he has been teaching them mechanic work. There is no spare parts shop near to his workshop. Customers have to go so far away to buy problematic spare parts. He wants to offer spare parts too, so that his customers do not feel any problem during the repairs. Therefore, Najma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to provide troubleshooting services and buy new spare parts.

Najma says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for repairing motorbikes and rickshaws.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a married woman with one child who goes to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has been in business operating a retail shop for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She dreams of opening a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu so that she could access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Shazia Rasheed

texts.en:
Shazia is 38 years old and married with four children between the ages of 5 and 12 years old. 

She stitches clothes for a living. Shazia has five years of experience in this work, and she currently employs three people to help her. She works from 5 a.m until 7 p.m every day except for Saturday.

Shazia has requested a Kiva loan via BRAC in order to buy a boutique for the growth of her business. 

With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future, pay school fees for her children, and reinvest in her business in order to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a boutique.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep and goats.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
This is Vicente, 63, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Estrella, a teacher, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses. 
 
Vicente operates a piggery. He earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes he has the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from this he also operates a farm where he gets additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 5,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. 

Vicente dreams to have strength and good health to do what he has to do, and he hopes to be successful in business and in life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.  There, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed for his business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has four children and has been a farmer for five years. Her primary income source is selling milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Milking." Her biggest challenge is "Fluctuations in the price of milk." Animals on the farm have been given the names of Amani and Peace.

Edna was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "A JKL officer reached out to our group." This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "One can get farming assets through JKL."

Her highest monthly expense are her family expenses. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Edna replied, "It will help me to get enough food for my children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Edna owns the following: a cow, poultry and a bicycle. She does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net and electricity, but not solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saber

texts.en:
Saber is 56 years old. He lives in Gaza with his wife and his three children.
For the past three years he has run his own grocery store, which helped him in gathering money and ensuring a good financial life for his kids. He sells different kinds of food stuffs, like soft drinks and kids’ stuff. He hopes that this loan will allow him to buy shelves and new decorations.
Saber is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy shelves and new decorations for his grocery store.

loans.name: Pilika Pilika Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her mid 40s, is married with three school children. For three years, Rose has had two businesses: a grocery and a guest house at the same place. She is doing great in these businesses. Rose works from 8:00AM - 12:00PM and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Rose used her previous loans to buy guest house equipment like two mattresses and two beds. She also used the loans to restock drinks like beer, water, soda, juice and more spirits. Rose managed to pay back all her loans successfully. With the profit from her business, she managed to start building a house, and pay for school fees and some home expenses. Rose will use this loan to buy business equipment like a TV, sofa set and stools for her grocery customers. She dreams of building a house to rent. 

Rose will share this loan with her loan group "PILIKA PILIKA," which consist of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business equipment like a TV, sofa set and stools for her grocery customers.

loans.name: Weam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Waem and it is made up of six women. All members are hardworking women who are making efforts to improve their living standards. 
Eynas is a clever, skillful, and calm 31-year-old woman. She is a house wife and tries her best to provide a good life for her children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is an amazing person with unusually good, humane qualities. She wants a good future for her children because she missed the chance to study and receive a higher education. She would like to improve her home by buying new furniture and some home appliances, but the main hardship that she faces is a lack of money. For this reason, she took a loan from AMB. This loan will help her to improve her home and her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and some home appliances.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a married woman with seven school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kabibi operates a food-making business, making basics like, beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
This is Sonia, 53; a resident of Batasan,Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Sonia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Sonia hopes to expand her business, and dreams to have a good life and happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nzai

texts.en:
Nzai lives in Kaloleni area, which is near Mariakani area. He is 35 years old and married with two children. He has been in the animal sale business for the last one year, and the business is growing.

He started the business from the savings he made himself. He knew Milango through friends and joined so that he could save and be able to access funding for his business.

He now seeks a loan to buy some goats to sell. He hopes that in five years time, he will expand his business to other branches and be able to reach more people, despite the usual challenges of seasonal weather. He will use the income that he will raise to build a permanent structure for the animals when they are waiting to be sold.

loans.use: to buy some goats to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children; one is still underage and the other one is in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and house consumables.

For over three months, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Priston

texts.en:
Priston is married man with four children, two in school and two adults. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water.

He repairs maintenance and service vehicles. He has been in this business for the last ten years.

With the loan of 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase spare parts, tools and grease for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, tools and grease for his business.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maritza del Carmen es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, un poblado ubicado a 90 kilómetros del departamento de León. En este bello pueblo prevalecen los ríos caudalosos y frondosos, sus casas son en su mayoría de tipo colonial de tejas y ladrillos de barro.
Maritza es madre soltera de dos niños que estudian la primaria, ella trabaja como asistente en una Institución de la localidad donde tiene varios años de laborar.
Se siente muy agradecida con Kiva y Ceprodel porque le han otorgado varios créditos que le han ayudado a cambiar las condiciones de vida de su familia, donde ha mejorado su vivienda y mejorado la salud de dicha familia.
En este momento Maritza está pasando por una situación difícil en su familia, ya que su abuelita está mal de salud y necesitan realizarle una operación de emergencia por lo que está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas de Kiva para apoyar en los gastos de dicha operación.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud.
texts.en:
Maritza del Carmen is from the municipality of El Sauce, a town located 90 km from the department of León.  This beautiful town is full of wide, lush rivers and its houses are mostly colonials made of clay bricks with tile roofs.  

Maritza is a single mother of two children who are in elementary school.  She works as an assistant at a local school, where she has been for several years.  

She is very thankful to Kiva and Ceprodel because they have granted her several loans, which have helped her to change her family's living conditions by improving her home and improving her family's health.  

Maritza is currently going through a difficult family situation as her grandma is in poor health and needs an emergency operation, which is why she is asking Kiva's lenders for a loan to help with the cost of this operation.  

She hopes and trusts in God that these goodhearted people will help her with her request.

loans.use: to pay for her grandmother's surgery

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has three children and has been a farmer for nine years. Her primary income source is selling milk and eggs.

She stated that what she most enjoys about farming is cleaning the dairy unit for her animals. Her biggest challenge is fluctuations in milk prices. Animals on the farm have been given the name of Kemboi (born at night).

Emily was referred to Juhudi Kilimo by another group. The client learned from the training to focus on her stated project after getting the loan.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Emily said that she would be able to pay school fees for her children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Emily owns a cow, poultry and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net and solar power, but not electricity, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abdul Kazem

texts.en:
Abdul Kazem is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has three children. Abdul Kazem works hard to provide his family's income and the school fees of his three children all by himself.

Abdul Kazem owns a shop where he sells bags of flour for bakeries. He has been in this field since 2009 and has gained much experience in what he practices. He is well-known in the market thanks to the great quality of his goods which are offered at competitive prices.

Abdul Kazem is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. Abdul Kazem is aiming to grow his business and increase his selling of products so that he may provide more income and better standards for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a married mother of three children; two in school and one underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

Saumu cooks fried potatoes and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jayne

texts.en:
Jayne lives in Mariakani area in Kenya. She has been doing poultry farming as a business for the last three years. She started the business out of her own personal savings, and the business is doing great.

She knew Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to enlarge the poultry hutch and premises. She hopes that the business will be large enough to be a supplier to government institutions and schools. 

The major challenge in the business is diseases, which is very dangerous. Price changes and inflation also affect the business very much. The extra income that she will raise will improve her savings and standards of living.

loans.use: to enlarge the poultry hutch and premises.

loans.name: Ahsan

texts.en:
Ahsan is druggist and 43 years old. He and his family are IDP(Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city, and now they live in Bahmanli village of Füzuli region. He has two sons; they are 15 and 17 years old. One of them goes to 11th class and the other goes 9th class.

Ahsan has been in this business for 12 years. Now he needs 900 AZN to buy new medicines to grow his business and increase his monthly income. He wants to sell more products and support the growing needs of the family. It should also be noted that he lives on the border area, and there is a need to bring new medicines to meet the demands of that area.

Ahsan is thankful to Kiva and Komak for the loan. In the future, he wants to have a big  pharmacy, and his sons want to continue the profession.

loans.use: to buy new medicines.

loans.name: Indira De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Indira de los Ángeles es una joven Sauceña de 24 años, casada, con una niña que se gana la vida laborando como Oficial de atención al cliente en una Institución del mismo municipio donde lo que más prevalece de ella es su carisma y amabilidad.
Como toda Nicaragüense que se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras desde muy joven inició a laborar para ganarse el pan de cada día y sustentar a su pequeña hija.
Sueña con culminar su carrera y ser una contadora por lo cual está luchando para alcanzar su objetivo y debido a su trabajo estudia los sábados en la ciudad de León.
Debido a que su salario es bajo hay momentos en que se ve con la dificultad para el pago de la universidad por lo que está solicitando un préstamo a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le apoyen, con el objetivo de pagar los aranceles y un curso universitario y en un futuro no tener obstáculos para terminar su carrera.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud donde les quedará eternamente agradecida.
texts.en:
Indira de los Ángeles is a young resident of El Sauce. She is 24 years old, married, and has one daughter.  She earns her living as a customer service representative at an institution in her municipality where her charisma and friendliness shine.

Like all Nicaraguans, who are known for being hard workers, she started working at a young age to earn her daily bread and support her young daughter.  

She dreams of finishing her studies and becoming an accountant and she is working hard to achieve her dream.  Because she works, she takes classes on Saturdays in the city of León.  

Due to her low salary, there are times when she had trouble paying for university, which is why she is asking Kiva's lenders for a loan through Ceprodel.  She needs it to pay her enrollment fees and to pay for one university course and to ensure that she will not face any barriers to finishing her studies in the future.  

She hopes and trusts in God that goodhearted people will help her with her request, for which she will be eternally thankful.

loans.use: to pay her enrollment fees and to pay for one university course

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is a 41-year-old Iraqi client. He is married and has 3 children, one of whom is employed and the other 2 are continuing their studies.
Hussain is a degree-holder technician. He specializes in repairing air-conditions.

After gaining his degree in this field, Hussain worked as an employee for a couple of years in this field in order to gain some experience. After gaining all the needed experience, Hussain established his own business in 2010, and now he has an employee hired. Hussain grew fast with fame and respect in the area, thanks to his experience.

Hussain is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. The aim of this loan is to install a rolling shutter, sunshade and signage for his shop. He is aiming to grow more in this field and increase his profits in order to continue providing his family will better standards.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, sunshade, and signage for his shop.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 69 years old and living in the suburb of the capital city-Tbilisi. She is married and has three grown children living with her. Eter and her husband are retired and their children are employed at the governmental institutions. They get monthly salaries and help their parents cover every day costs.

Eter used to have a small grocery store in front of her house for four years, but she had some financial problems and her business had stopped.
Eter is warmly appreciative to all Kiva lenders as thanks to the help they have given her. She will be able to restart the business and purchase stocks of merchandise.

She owns all the needed equipment: refrigerators, display shelves, scales, etc. and is ready to run the business with love and care. Eter hopes her project will be successful again, as she will generate income and improve the living conditions of her family members.

loans.use: to restart her grocery business and purchase stocks of merchandise.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a married woman with no children. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves. and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Samad

texts.en:
Samad is 21 years old and not married. After finishing school, Samad decided to start his own business. For that, he decided to grow fruits and vegetables. His father also helps him in this business because he didn't have any practice. 

Day by day, Samad wanted to expand his business but did not have enough funds for that. He is requesting a 2,000 AZN loan to buy fertilizer and improve his fruit plantation. He wants to complete the maintenance necessary for harvesting so he will have higher production, and therefore, more income.

In the future, he hopes to give his parents a better quality of life and better economic stability. He also wants to keep growing as a person and a farmer. This is going to be his second loan. Samad hopes that Kiva will help him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to improve his fruit plantation.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 6 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Selling milk.' Her biggest challenge is 'Washing tits of my animal when milking.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'The black and white.'

Esther was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Juhudi Kilimo officer outreached their group.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to acquire an asset through saving little cash with Juhudi Kilimo.'

Her highest monthly expenses are school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Esther replied 'Will pay school fees with ease for her children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Esther owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle,' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net and running water,' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, or DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is a 27-year-old man. He lives with his parents in the Akhaltsikhe district. His mother works as a cook at a local restaurant and gets 300 GEL (Georgian lari)  per month. This is the only source of income for the family, and it is not enough for the family's needs. 

Shota requested a loan for re-starting their family business, which was stopped three years ago. His plan now is to continue to work on his business and to make it grow. Shota applied for the credit with MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the start-up loan program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

A loan of $1,900 will help Shota to purchase a stock of groceries and re-open the grocery store, improving the quality and enlarging the quantity of products. He will buy supplies such as sugar, soft drinks, snacks and more to better stock his store. With this financial support, Shota will generate income, which will help him expand his grocery store in the future and attract more customers. He promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a married mother of two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Rosemary cooks fried potatoes and sells them to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Al-Etihad Group

texts.en: Al-Etihad group is composed of four women from Sana`a, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 160,000 YER (Yemen rials) to purchase food and drinks for resale. Saida, a 32-year-old single woman, is the leader of the group. She earns a low income that isn't enough to cover expenses. In order to increase her working capital, she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER to buy sugar, flour, canned food, etc., for her business. She hopes to be able to earn a considerable profit to pay for her living expenses, and those of her parents.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, canned food, etc., for her business.

loans.name: José Ismael

texts.es:
José de 65 años de edad, esta acompañado y ha procreado tres hijos.  Debido al nivel económico que presentaban sus padres solo pudo estudiar una primaria, ya que tenían que trabajar todo el día y era un grupo familiar bastante numeroso y todos trabajaban para mantener a su familia.  Su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y ya formaron su propia familia. 

Él se dedica a trabajar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, también se dedica a cuidar bovinos, se a dedicado a trabajar la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño con sus padres y sus hermanos también se dedicaba a tiempo jornal.
También se dedica a cuidar bovinos de repasto, los trabajos agrícolas los realiza a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa, tiene que madrugar para llegar temprano donde tiene los cultivos, trabaja casi todo el día; ya que si es posible se quedan en esos lugares, debido a que el acceso es bastante limitado, se quedan cuidando los cultivos por las noches.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas; abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo. Se espera favorecer mejor el cultivo de maíz y lograr tener al final de la cosecha una mayor producción y tener mejores ingresos para su familia

 Espera seguir trabajando para mantener a su compañera de vida y comprar ganado de respasto, ya que este le servirá para mantenerse para su vejez, las ganancias las utiliza en la compra de ganado
texts.en:
José is 65 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has three children. Due to his parents’ economic level, he was only able to finish primary school, as they had to work all day, and there were many family members. They all worked to support their family. His life partner works as a housekeeper; his children are already grown and have their own families. 

He farms 14,000 square meters of corn, and he also raises cattle. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young alongside his parents and siblings; he also worked as a day laborer.

He also works raising beef cattle. He does his agricultural work 2 kilometers from his house. He has to get up early to arrive early to his fields. He works almost the entire day, since if it were possible he would stay in that area, but because access is very limited, he stays until night caring for his crops.

The loan funds will be used to purchase agricultural supplies, compost, fertilizer, payment for workers, and to prepare the land for farming. He hopes to better support his corn crop and succeed in having better production at the end of the season, and to have better earnings for his family. 

He hopes to continue working to support his life partner and to purchase beef cattle, as they will serve to support him in his old age. He will use the earnings to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, compost, fertilizer, to pay workers, and to prepare his land for farming.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a tea farmer, age 45 years and growing strong to do more farming and achieve his goal in life. He works five hours daily on the tea farm, and works six days a week. 

He started tea farming in 2000 with the hope of getting money to sustain his family. The farm is located in rural Bushenyi district. He hopes to use the loan money (1,500,000 UGX) to buy fertilizers to put in his tea farm as a way of increasing the fertility of the farmland so that he can have better and improved harvests.

In addition to tea growing, he also trades in new shoes, which boosts his incomes in a given period. Despite the challenge of extreme weather conditions, Leonard hopes of establishing a fully furnished home using the profits he will get from the tea growing business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for his tea farm.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with five children who are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Riziki operates a food making business, making staples like rice, beans, dumplings and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. 

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 63 years old and is supporting a family of four people. She has been in this business for the last 19 years with the monthly income of 4,800 KES (Kenyan shillings). Mabel has managed to get her eighth loan from KADET LTD of 60,000 KES, with which she plans to purchase water for selling and more chickens. The anticipated profit she will keep for the welfare of the children she is taking care of. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business for selling water to be a big business.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken, water and eggs.

loans.name: Msakuzi A1 Group

texts.en:
Esther, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children who are in school. Since 1998, Esther has been managing two different businesses: a dry food shop that sells rice, maize flour, baking flour, beans, sugar and other food, and a charcoal business. Esther starts working from 6:00 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. per working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. Esther dreams to build a nice family house. She will share this loan with her loan group "MSAKUZI A1," which consists of six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a man of 48 years, married to Franciscah, and a father of seven children. He operates a taxi business in Kangemi and has been in this business for six years. He gets a monthly income of 70,000 shillings.
This will be Alfred's second loan with KADET LTD. He wants to use the entire loan to buy spare parts for his taxi and also pay for school fees. In the future, he wants to educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, service the taxi, and pay for school fees

loans.name: Nasa Al-Thwra Group

texts.en: This group of four hard-working women is called Nasa Al-Thwra. The members live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 210,000 YER from AMB. Bushra is a 30-year-old married woman living in a poor area in Sana'a. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, which is now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. She has therefore requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy construction materials in order to finish building her house. She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BADEGNA, sont mariées, ont en moyenne 49 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tingolé, commune de Binko, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du riz, le haricot le poisson, les céréales et les condiments.
La cliente Mariam la première personne à droite, est vendeuse de condiments. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter une grande quantité de condiments auprès des grossistes et effectue ses ventes en détail et au comptant. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15000 FCFA dont une partie  sera  réutilisée dans l’activité et le reste dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Badegna group of women are married, are on average 49 years old with five children, and all live in traditional extended families in the village of Tingolé, in the Binko district, which belongs to the Dioila prefecture, in Koulikoro (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell condiments and various goods. The Badegna group of women are on their first group loan which will be used to buy rice, beans, fish, cereals and condiments.

Group member Mariam is the first on the right, and sells condiments. With this loan she will buy a large amount of condiments from wholesalers and then retail them for cash.

She hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, part of which will be reused in the activity and the rest in family expenses.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina,26, is a young mother of three that lives with her family in Totolapan, Morelos. Regina works selling the crops of her neighbor and roughly makes around one dollar per day. Her working hours are long and has to manage to cook and do other chores. Regina lives in a one bedroom house where she sleeps with her husband Eri, a local driver, and their two children Margarita and Santiago. Each time they have to use the restroom they have to walk a couple blocks to the community facility. To avoid this when showering, they simply use a bucket and do it by cupfuls. Regina and Eri have been living here for the last 10 years, working hard to save and continuously improve their house. 

Since Regina and Eri do not have formal jobs and their income is low and variable, neither of them have access to credit from banks or other organizations. Regina has been saving for the last three months to build a new bedroom for her kids and a bathroom for the family. She is now asking for a loan to complete the payment of materials needed. The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new room will give the kids their own space to play, sleep and study and the bathroom will give a healthier life and privacy to the family. 

Regina and Eri did not have the chance to finish their education and were forced to drop out after elementary. They want to make sure they take the right steps to give better opportunities to their children, and support them as they work their way through school.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a bedroom and bathroom for her two children

loans.name: Camila

texts.en:
Cəmila is 34 years old. She has been married for 13 years and has two children who attend school. Now she lives in Ashagi Gulzak village of Füzuli with her family, but they are IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city. Her children are in the third and fifth grade and as they get older, her husband’s salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses.

Previously she took a loan from Kiva and with this loan she bought foodstuffs for her store. Now she has been in the cattle business for 2 years. Today she needs 1,850 AZN, to prepare for Winter, she will buy enough hay for her cattle and vaccinations.

She is thankfull to Komak and Kiva for supporting her for the second time. She wants to increase her business and monthly income in the future. She wants give a high education to her children.

loans.use: to buy enough hay for her cattle and for vaccinations

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old. He has been a maize farmer for the past fifteen years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. Fertilizer increases the crop yield. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and pay for fertilizer for his corn

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 58 years old. He is married with six children. He has spent 20 years maize farming. He will use this Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for his maize farm, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farm he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer for his corn farm

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 30-year-old married Palestinian refugee and a mother of 2 children. Sixteen years ago, she opened  a convenience store inside the Palestinian camp where she lives with her family, just like most of the Palestinian Refugees living in Lebanon with limited access to many working sectors. She sells candies and canned foods, and many other food supplies. She is her family’s sole breadwinner, that’s why she has to work hard and keep on improving her business to make sure it’ll develop to continue to meet her family’s increasing needs.
She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva Partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special goods that will increase her income.
Concerning the future, Suzan is working hard to keep on expanding her business and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to increase her variety of merchandise

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en: Everlyn is 41 years old married to Moses, they both support a family of seven. She runs a retail shop in Kipsigak trading centre in Nandi County served by KADET Ltd Kapsabet office. This has been her business for the last nine years; she gets an average monthly income of KES 12,000. She plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 96, 000 to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat among other items for resale. She anticipates getting profits of which she will use to pay her children’s school fees. Her dream and hope is for her business to grow and be stable to give her steady and reliable income to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat among other items for her general store

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 48 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tingolé commune de Binko, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du riz, le haricot le poisson, les céréales et les condiments.
La cliente Mariam Tenin  la troisième personne de la gauche vers la droite, est vendeuse de tubercules. Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter une grande quantité de tubercules. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12500 FCFA dont une partie  sera  réutilisée dans l’activité et le reste dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi group are all married, are on average 48 years old with 4 children, and all live in traditional extended families in the village of Tingolé, in the Binko district, which is part of the Dioila prefecture, in Koulikoro (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. The Benkadi group of women are on their first group loan which will be used to buy rice, beans, fish, cereals and condiments.

Group member Mariam Tenin is the third person from the left to the right, and sells tubers. With this loan she will buy a large amount of tubers.

She expects to achieve an average monthly profit of 12,500 CFA francs, part of which will be reused in the activity and the rest in family expenses.

loans.use: buy tubers

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tingolé commune de Binko, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce et de restauration. 
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. La cliente Sira  la deuxième personne à gauche, est une restauratrice qui vend du haricot cuite. Elle compte acheter 60 kg de haricot avec ce prêt. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22000 FCFA dont une partie  sera  réutilisée dans l’activité et le reste dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya group are all married, are on average 40 years old with five children, and all live in traditional extended families in the village of Tingolé, in the Binko district, which is part of the Dioila prefecture, in Koulikoro (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They are active in commerce and catering. The Danaya group of women is on their third group loan.

Group member Sira is the second from the left, and is a caterer who sells baked beans. She intends to buy 60 kg of beans with this loan.

She expects to achieve an average monthly profit of 22,000 CFA francs, part of which will be reused in the activity and the rest in family expenses.

loans.use: buy beans for catering

loans.name: Kotakegne Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotakegne, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tingolé commune de Binko, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, du  savon, de charbon et les céréales. 
Les femmes du groupe Kotakegne sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Aramata  la première personne dans le rang des assises est vendeuse de céréales. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de riz et 1 sac d’arachide. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui  sera  réutilisée dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The women in the Kotakegne group are all married, are on average 44 years old with five children, and all live in traditional extended families in the village of Tingolé, in the Binko district, which is part of the Dioila prefecture, in Koulikoro (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell condiments, soap, coal and grain. The Kotakegne group of women are on their ninth group loan.

Group member Aramata is the first person sitting, and sells grain. With this loan she intends to buy two bags of rice and one bag of peanuts. She expects to achieve an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs which will be reused in the activity.

loans.use: buy grain cereals

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouma, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tingole commune de Binko, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers. 
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouma sont à leur neuvième prêt.
La cliente Alimata  la première personne à droite, dans le rang des assises est vendeuse de condiments. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter une grande quantité de condiments car elle se voit renforcer ses capacités une fois de plus. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15000 FCFA dont une partie  sera  réutilisée dans l’activité et le reste dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The women in the Sabougnouma group are all married, are on average 37 years old with three children, and all live in traditional extended families in the village of Tingolé, in the Binko district, which is part of the Dioila prefecture, in Koulikoro (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell a variety of items. The Sabougnouma group of women are on their ninth loan.

Group member Alimata is the first sitting on the right, and sells condiments. With this loan she will buy a large amount of condiments because she intends to bolster her capacity once again.

She expects to achieve an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, part of which will be reused in the activity and the rest in family expenses.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Lyria es Madre Soltera. De 37 años de edad. Escolaridad secundaria completa. Tiene 3 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando. Tiene un Comedor y ella lo atiende todo el día, inició este negocio con la ayuda de su madre y a la fecha lleva 12 años de experiencia. 

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos. Desea en el futuro tener un local bien establecido en el centro del municipio. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de comida y tortillería.
texts.en:
Maria Lyria is 37 years old and is a single mother. She finished her high school education and has 3 children, 2 of whom are studying. She has a restaurant and works there all day. She started the business with her mother's help and has been doing this for 12 years.

Maria Lyria is the organizer of a group and she is asking for a loan which she will use to buy supplies for preparing food. In the future she would like to have a well established premises in the centre of town.

The other members of the group earn a living selling food and making tortillas.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: Bahtovar

texts.ru: Бахтовар родилась в 1994 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Бахтовар студент 2 курса. Он учится в Таджикском Государственном Университете в факультете Востоковедение. Он учится успешно и активно участвует во всех мероприятиях. Бахтовар должен оплатить за учебный договор. Его родители не имеют денег, чтобы поддержать его. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bahtovar was born in 1994. He is not married and lives with parents. Bahtovar is a second year student. He is studying in the Tajik State University and majors in the eastern studies. He studies well and actively takes part in all of the events. Bahtovar has to pay for the tuition. His parents do not have money to support him. He is asking for a loan to pay for the tuition. He is waiting for your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.ru: Мичгона является мастером своего дела. Она опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Ей 25 лет. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 2 года назад она начала свой бизнес. Она имеет свой цех. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Она нуждается новой швейной машинки, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки новой швейной машинки. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mijgona is a master of her craft. She is an experienced seamstress and creates works of art in the Tajik traditional dresses. She is 25 years old. She is divorced and is raising one child. With the goal to support her family with all of the necessities Mijgona has started her own business two years ago. She has her own shop. Because of her good service she has a wide range of customers. Mijgona needs a new sewing machine, but her income does not allow her to buy it. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 USD to buy a new sewing machine. She hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machine.

loans.name: El Reencuentro  (Tosagua) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal  El Rencuentro  se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
Este es un grupo formado por 9 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les va a servir de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos van a mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, ganadería y la agricultura.
 Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora María, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 8 años que estudian en la escuela. El marido es controlador de un bus de transporte. 
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace lo posible por darle a su familia lo mejor, trabaja de vendedora de equipos para una empresa telefónica pero además tiene su propio negocio, ella con la ayuda de su mamá preparan deliciosos platos para entregar, preparan almuerzos y también los fines de semana o en ocasiones preparan comida para cualquier tipo de evento social.  Tienen este negocio más de 6 años  por lo cual ya cuentan con muy buena clientela, en cuanto a su trabajo ella trabaja por horas lo cual le da tiempo para cumplir con todas sus actividades.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Este es su primer ciclo igual que todos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salió el crédito. 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darle una buena educación a su hijo. 
L foto pñequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuendo se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The  "El Reencuentro" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Tosagua canton, a place which is known for being very dynamic, where most of the inhabitants work in agriculture or rearing animals, as there is a lot of vegetation in the area. This group is made up of 9 women and 2 men who decided to get together and form this communal bank which will help them a lot since they will use the loans to improve their small businesses. They work in different jobs such as sales, rearing animals and agriculture.

One of the members of the group is María who is 29 years old. She lives with her partner with whom she has an 8 year old son who is studying at the primary school. Her husband is a bus ticket inspector. María is a very hard-working woman who does all she can to give her family the best. She sells equipment for a telephone company but she also has her own business. With her mum's help she makes delicious dishes to sell; they make lunches and also at the weekends and for special occasions they make food for any kind of social event. They have had the business for more than 6 years and so they have a very good clientele.  María's job is part-time which gives her time to fit in all her other tasks.

María will use the loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other provisions for preparing the food. Along with everyone else in the communal bank, this is her first loan and she is happy with the speed with which the loan was granted. Her goals are to keep moving forward with the business and give her son a good education.

The small photo is of two members who couldn't be there when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other provisions.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan tiene 25 años y para poder salir adelante trabaja como ayudante de construcción, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, ya que depende del tamaño de la obra que tiene que realizar, asimismo Juan tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de cuyes con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para los gastos de su hogar; Juan cree que le está yendo bien en su trabajo porque es amable y cumplido con sus clientes.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales de construcción para construir jaulas para cuyes, con lo cual va poder criar a sus  en mejores condicione y sus clientes van a comprar con más confianza, así el mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Juan is 25 years old and to get ahead in life he works as a construction assistant. He works close to 9 hours every day -depending on the scope of the labor that he has to complete- and he also runs a small business selling guinea pigs, which provides additional income to cover household expenses. Juan beliefs that his business is thriving  because he is kind and responsible with his customers.

Juan is very thankful to Kiva Lenders, because thanks to the support that they provide he will be able to buy the materials to build cages for the guinea pigs, which will allow him to keep them in much better conditions, and his customers will buy from him with greater confidence. In this way, Juan will be able to increase his income, and continue to work  to realize his dearest dream: “Complete the construction of his own house”.

loans.use: to buy materials to build cages.

loans.name: Los Cisnes Group

texts.es:
Doña Adela es un miembro en el grupo Los Cisnes, ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora que desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar para salir adelante, ella tiene la edad de 53 años y comenta que desde hace 11 años adquirió un molino de maíz e inició con su propio negocio de venta de masa.
 
Ella comenta que su trabajo comienza desde la tarde del día anterior, pone a hervir el maíz para al siguiente día por la mañana levantarse muy temprano a moler el maíz y después embolsarlo y salir a venderlo casa por casa por las colonias de Tierra Blanca.

Doña Adela platica "Antes la gente iba al molino con su maíz a moler pero ahora les gusta que todo lo vayan a vender a la puerta de su casa. Saliendo a vender por de casa en casa me ayuda a  ganar mi propio dinero y salir adelante"

Un crédito de VisionFund y de Kiva le ayudará a comprar maíz y dar mantenimiento a su molino para continuar con sus ventas. Ella espera que su negocio continué progresando y asi mejorar su calidad de vida.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Teresa venta de comida 
Ana venta de bisuteria
Narcisa taller de costura 
Concepción siembra de limon
Alicia venta de refrescos
Agripina venta de comida 
Ana Leidi venta de ropa 
Jesús siembra de maiz, pepino y frijol
Zehen venta de tortillas
Miriam venta de zapatos
